Summary: We decided to stay here with our family during a recent trip to Di$neyland (actually far more $ required in that name these days).  We booked a Penthouse Loft Suite (2nd and 3rd floor of a 3 story building) as this provided 2 bathrooms and 2 king size beds (which we need as our kids are getting more adult-sized).    The most striking thing was the flooring which was sloping in places and seemed to be missing or having a very thin subfloor throughout based on the amount of 'give' it had in places.  We had to keep on reminding our children to walk lightly as their usual stomping up and down stairs vibrated and echoed throughout the building.  The kitchen and eating area was fine, the living room was adequate (but not really 'comfy' as such) - we ended up spending most of the time
Room tip: Didn't really hear any noise from the nearby freeway which was surprising.

Summary: This place seemed to be okay so I booked it only to find out the charge a 300.00 for incidentals unlike others that charge 25.00 I cancelled my stay but they had ran my card already and advised it will take 3 - 5 days to show up. So stay away from this place
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to share your feedback.  Each hotel's incidental/security deposit is different, ranging from $25 to $500.  The hotel releases the hold, but the card holder's bank typically take 3-5 days to release the hold on their end.  I'm very sorry for this inconvenience.  You may get the hold released sooner by calling the 800 number on the back of your credit/debit card.   With kind regards, Tish S.

Summary: This is not a place that accommodate mostly business travelers just want a place to rest and have some peace after a long work day.  Guests sign statement of proper behavior; otherwise, they can be asked to leave. My company made reservations for my peers and I to stay at hotel due to a job assignment at a hospital in the area.   In the room above me, kids (I think two) sounded like they were jumping off the bed, doing gymnastic flips and beam mounts from the first day I checked-in, I notified the front desk to no avail.   When first tried to enter my room, I had a problem with the room key and an employee came to help me with getting the door open—1st signal the hotel was a wrong place for me to stay. When we were in the room, after the employee opened the door, I said to the
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to provide feedback about your stay with us.  I'm very sorry to hear about the inconveniences you experienced while staying with us.  I would be frustrated as well, especially given the early hours of your job.  Please accept my sincerest apology.  We truly value each and every guest, and we appreciate you staying with us.   With sincere regards, Tish

Summary: This place might be the worst hotel I have ever stayed at. Incredible noise coming from the neighbors, cleanliness is always a problem, parking is an absolute nightmare. Do not stay here if you are looking for a quiet place for your family
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to provide feedback about your recent stay.  I would love to speak to you in person about your experience.  I hope to speak with you soon! With kindest regards, Tish

Summary: We stayed in a bi-level family suite with sofa bed and loft for six nights during a recent vacation to Disneyland. We were very pleased with our choice to stay here as it worked well for our family of five. The hotel is located in an industrial area, but it feels safe and is in close proximity to restaurants, shopping (including Costco and Target), and about a 10-minute drive to Disneyland. The hotel is very welcoming and attractive and feels more like an apartment home than a hotel. Our suite was HUGE, clean, and modern.   The two adults in our group stayed in the loft. The loft bedroom doesn’t have a door and there is an open wall behind the bed that looks out over the living room/sofa bed, but the bedroom in the loft does have a door. The bathroom has a bathtub and toilet,
Room tip: Bi-level suites on top floor are nice
Manager Response: Thank you so much for taking the time to provide such a wonderful review of the Residence Inn Placentia!  I agree that our hotel is a wonderful bargain considering our large suites, complimentary breakfast buffet, and close proximity to Disneyland!  We hope to see you and your family again soon! With sincere regards, Tish S.

Summary: This was our second time staying at this particular location. The first was in October 2018 for 10 days, the second (this time) in August 2019 for 12 days. Obviously we liked the place well enough to come back! The rooms are spacious and thoughtfully laid out, and it's always great to have access to a fridge. Conveniently located right next to SR-57 it's easy to get anywhere quickly, but the rooms are soundproofed well enough that the freeway noise is negligible.   The hotel has great wifi, solid service and good amenities. We took advantage of their free breakfast most mornings (tasty, and enough of a spread to not get boring, plus the staff is quick to refresh anything running low and very friendly) and used the pool. The layout of the hotel means you don't hear much if
Manager Response: Thank you so much for taking the time to write such a wonderful review of the Residence Inn Placentia!  Thank you for the valuable feedback as we use it to improve the experience for all our valued guests.  We look forward to seeing you again soon! With kindest regards, Tish S.

Summary: The loft is great for the space, but the personable service is what I remember most. Manager Edwardo made us feel welcomed and appreciated.  His warm, inviting persona will be what brings us back.  Thank you for taking such good care of us!
Room tip: It looks like an apartment moreso than a hotel.
Manager Response: Thank you for this wonderful feedback about the Residence Inn Placentia!  I'm so glad we took great care of you and your family.  I hope you will come and stay with us again soon! With kindest regards, Tish S.

Summary: We came into town for a concert, and this Residence Inn was perfect!  We loved the location, kinda tucked away near an industrial spot, but very quiet.  It was located within 5 minutes of the venue we were going to, and also within 5 minutes from Anaheim Stadium and maybe 10 from Downtown Disney.  The checkin was easy and the team member that greeted me was excellent, I just wish I could remember her name. She directed me to our room and mentioned many details about the hotel and things nearby.  Our room was so nice and spacious.  The kitchenette area was stocked and everything was clean and ready to use. There were plenty of plug-ins for the iron, phones, laptops, and other devices.  The bed was so comfortable, and the building we were located in was very quiet.  The facility
Manager Response: Thank you so much for taking the time to provide such amazing feedback about the Residence Inn Placentia!  I'm so happy you enjoyed our hotel with full kitchens and full hot breakfast!  I hope you will come and stay with us again soon! Many thanks! Tish S., General Manager

Summary: I was trying to find a hotel that allowed a dog.  This property was the only one around that was decent that allowed a dog.  I was so happy it was a two bedroom with a loft room.  I didn't think about it being up stairs but yes when you think about it....loft would mean it would need to be an upstairs room.  The room was wonderful but the downstairs bedroom had no air conditioning in it and it was stuffy and hot.  The kitchen was wonderful...again...the two flights of stairs were not.....The remodel others were talking about was still going on...it's a big one for sure!  The parking was okay but small spaces.  The real concern I had is right over the wall between the hotel and the freeway is a massive homeless encampment.  They even have generators humming so it's pretty will
Room tip: If you have a lot of luggage I would ask to be on the outside part of the hotel not the courtyard!
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to provide feedback about your recent stay with us!  I'm happy to hear you and your furry friend had a good experience with us, and I hope you will come back again soon.  Our lobby makeover is nearing completion, and our brand new lobby and eating area will be unveiled in early June!  We're very excited to have a newly updated area for our guests to enjoy!  Thanks again! With kindest regards, Tish S.

Summary: Stayed in a suite with two baths. The room was very nice. The Kitchen fully equipped with pots, pans, and dishes.   The hotel was under renovation so we were directed to the laundry facility at the Quality Inn. Nobody told us their laundry facility closed at a certain hour (and I’m not used to this as most hotels I’ve stayed at don’t have a limit but require a key to access). However, the front desk attendant was very nice in allowing us to continue with our late night laundry. Soap was $2, to wash was $2.50 for 30 min, and to dry was $2.50 for 45 minutes. A good time to tell us the laundry room was closed was when I went to ask for quarters at the front desk. However.  The breakfast attendants were amazing and very friendly. We arrived a little later for breakfast and they were
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to provide your feedback about your recent stay with us.  We are very happy to hear you enjoyed our full hot breakfast and penthouse suite with a fully equipped kitchen!  I sincerely apologize for any inconvenience our lobby renovation caused you and your family.  We are very excited about our new lobby, and I know you will enjoy the brand new space which will be completed in April.  I hope you and your family will come and stay with us again! With kindest regards, Tish S.

Summary: The hotel is tucked away off Kimberly St/Dr. They are having some renovations done towards the front where reception is located. Rooms are quiet, we stayed in 713. Room comfortable, clean, spacey. The pool was out of commission due to repairs and so is the laundry. Breakfast area has been moved upstairs temporarily till March 2019. breakfast was good, had variety of food items.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to review our hotel.  We are very excited that we are renovating our lobby and gatehouse, and we know our guests will love the finished product!  We do have the same great breakfast in a different location, and I'm glad you enjoyed it!  We do have alternative options for our pool and laundry, and we're more than happy to share those options with our guests.  We look forward to seeing you again hopefully! With kind regards, Tish S.

Summary Heading: Friendly staff, ok location, dated room with strong scent
Summary: Great value compare to other hotels in Placentia/ Fullerton area, suits are much bigger than other hotel rooms. Kitchen was fully equipped if you prefer to cook, perfect if you don’t want to dine out every meal. The staff made us felt welcomed. Asked for a room not directly facing super busy free way and the room was not noisy, light sleeper approved.  However, the first thing I noticed once I enter the room was overwhelming smell from dated rooms. Opened the window to fresh up the room, it did help or we got used to it. But every time you enter the room after going out you can smell it again, pretty strong. Even stronger in the closets, since it’s mostly carpet in the room.   May or may not be related, experienced dizziness during my stay there. As we walk into the room, the
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to review our hotel!  I'm happy to hear you enjoyed our large suites with full sized kitchens!  I agree, our staff is wonderful and we love to welcome our new and repeat guests!  I hope you and your family will choose our hotel again when you're in the area. With kindest regards, Tish S.

Summary: Early in our stay, we noticed a leaking sprinkler which soaked mattress and floor causing us to move from a 2-story suite which we purposely reserved to 2 single rooms. Tiny eating area which caused many to take their food to their rooms.  Torn carpet in kitchen area and no chairs in living room area or bedrooms. Roach seen on kitchen counter of single room. No real hotel foyer, We were never told that the fireplace needed wood.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to share your experience.  I'm very sorry for the inconveniences you experienced while staying.  Unfortunately, some things happen this is beyond our control, and I'm sorry you had to move to another room due to this unforeseen event.  I hope you were able to enjoy your time in southern California in spite of the lapse in service you experienced at my hotel.  I wish you and your family a very happy New Year. With kindest regards, Tish S.

Summary Heading: A welcoming extended-stay hotel in Southern California
Summary: I was traveling to Anaheim for a big pharmacy convention. As usual, the hotels by the convention center are prohibitively expensive for my work budget. However, this is Anaheim and it is a driver friendly location. I had expected to rent a car since my co-worker and I were flying in and out of LAX and that helped to expand the pool of open hotels. Since I am an SPG/Marriott Rewards kind of guy, I narrowed my search to this portfolio of hotels and this was the closest under $200 a night.  We arrived after midnight and rang the bell to be let in to check in. The click was friendly and warm, and plain old welcoming after a long day of travel. He made sure that we had bottled water and set us up with rooms adjacent to each other.   We take the keys and drive the car to the back of
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to provide such wonderful feedback!  I'm so happy to hear you enjoyed your stay, were able to get well rested, and able to easily get to Anaheim each day!  It sounds like you were able to partake in our full hot breakfast, evening Mix, and fully equipped kitchen in your suite.  I hope you will stay with us again in your future travels to the Anaheim/Placentia/Fullerton area.  We look forward to seeing you again at the Residence Inn Placentia! With much appreciation, Tish S.

Summary: This has got to be the noisiest freeway hotel I have ever stayed in! We had a penthouse which provided great sized accommodation but the drone of traffic was constant. The loft bedroom was especially noisy and kept us awake for most of the night. The staff were very friendly and did try to change our rooms but the only one with 3 beds was still close to the freeway so we checked out and even though the next hotel was also a freeway hotel, it was super quiet. This hotel is very dated and the breakfast area is definitely way too small.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to share your feedback with us.  I'm sorry to hear you were disturbed by noise while you were staying in our hotel.  It's wonderful to hear you found our staff to be friendly and accommodating.  I hope you will consider staying with us in the future! With kind regards, Tish S.

Summary: Our upstairs king room was away from the freeway and quiet. The bed was comfortable and the room was clean. The property appeared to be well-maintained, and staff members were helpful and friendly. I think we successfully avoided lots of noisy children by staying closer to Fullerton than to Disneyland and Knott's Berry Farm. Breakfast was average Marriott fare, but I was disappointed that they still use styrofoam cereal bowls.
Manager Response: Thanks so much for taking the time to review the Residence Inn Placentia!  I'm so glad to hear you enjoyed one of our beautiful and quiet suites.  We love hearing from our guests, and I hope you will stay with us again soon! With kind regards, Tish S.

Summary: We planned to spend 5 nights at this Residence Inn but quickly checked out for several reasons: 1) It is in a questionable mostly industrial neighborhood that doesn't feel safe at night; 2) The front desk hassled us about our registered service dogs; 3) The front desk people were cold and unfriendly; 4) They had the nerve to charge for parking, when we've never encountered that at ANY Residence nationwide; 5) They stuck us in a handicapped room when we didn't request one (likely  because we were staying on reward points) and 6) There are few places nearby to eat or shop... this  a "freeway" property with nothing to recommend it.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to review our hotel.  I'm sorry you had a negative experience while staying with us.  Our associates are trained to ask about service animals, but the intention is never to be an inconvenience.  Our goal is to follow the proper regulations set forth by the ADA, and service dogs are always welcome at our hotel.  I hope you will consider staying with us again in the future. With kind regards, Tish S.

Summary Heading: Unexpected Outcome of conversation with the Manager
Summary: This hotel (Residence Inn by Marriott in Anaheim Placentia Fullerton) was highly recommended by my sister and was happy with their associates (employees) until the last day when we found a crawling cockroach and was first seen by my sister who also work in Marriott in SFO and she was surprised to see an insect in our room so she hurriedly called the office to let them know and 1 associate took the insect that we trapped on the floor with a glass of plastic glass of water and offered us some goodwills (2 small bottle water, 4 single packed Milano cookies and 2 plastic glassed wine) for apologizing of the experience that we had that day and promised that the Manager will call us for further action or explanation of the incident on Sept. 04 2018 when she comes back for there is no
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to share your feedback with us.  I'm very sorry to hear you experienced any inconvenience at our hotel.  We always strive for every guest to have a perfect and memorable stay, and it sounds like we fell short of this goal during your stay.  Thank you for your loyalty to Marriott. With kind regards, Tish S.

Summary Heading: Good hotel - but finding your room is like a maze
Summary: good location. I had a little trouble finding my room from the lobby. The layout is pretty confusing. Breakfast area is way too small. Food was OK nothing special. I took my breakfast and ate in the car in the parking lot because there's no space there.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to review our hotel!  I'm sorry to hear you had a difficult time finding your room.  We are always more than happy to escort you to your suite should you have difficulty finding your suite in the future.  Thank you for staying with us; we look forward to seeing you again soon! With kind regards, Tish S.

Summary: From the moment I arrived I was welcomed by staff. Check in was quick and fast. As I entered the room it was nice and cleaned. It felt like I was at home. Breakfast was lovely so many choices. The staff was courteous and always brought a seat for my Infant son. Disneyland was close and the beach too. I would recommend this to everyone. Hope too visit here soon. God bless.
Manager Response: Thank you so much for taking the time to review the Residence Inn Placentia!  It's wonderful to hear you were greeted by our friendly staff immediately, and you enjoyed one of our beautiful suites and full complimentary breakfast.  I'm so happy to hear you had a great time at Disneyland with your family.  Please come and stay with us again soon! With kindest regards, Tish S.

Summary Heading: Even as loyal customers, we were done wrong. A horrible, experience here at the Fullerton location!!!
Summary: We reserved a particular room a MONTH ahead of coming down to LA. We are not originally from Southern California and we haven't been to Disneyland in over a decade. I wanted to treat the family to a good, relaxing week at the famous amusement park and what better place to stay than Residence Inn? We've been loyal to Residence in for 5 years because we were always treated wonderfully and the rooms were always expected to be CLEAN and made. When we already booked a room for this location far before we arrived, we get a call from one of the employees telling us we've been DOWNGRADED to a lower type room because the room WE RESERVED WAS SOLD OUT!! How in the world is that possible, or fair?! Our children were ECSTATIC when they were told we'd all be getting our own beds and nobody
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to share your feedback about your recent experience.  I'm so very sorry to hear you and your family had this negative experience at our hotel.  We always care about our guests, and we want a happy and memorable experience for each and every person that stays with us.  I would love to speak to you personally if you would like to call me at the hotel at your convenience.  I hope you were able to enjoy your time at Disneyland in spite of the experience at the hotel. With kind regards, Tish S.

Summary Heading: great O.C. location, near Disneyland, beaches, and Knotts
Summary: We are staying two weeks due to water damage in our home. They have been extremely nice here,, rooms are huge, comfortable, and have full kitchens. Full breakfast every morning, rivals IHOP! Freeway close to the 57 and the 91,, minutes to Disneyland, Knott's Berry Farm, Medieval Times, and only 40 minutes to Newport Beach. One of the best hotels I have ever stayed in.

First off I want to say that I am a loyal Marriott customer. I am also a Platinum member. The property is nice. The problem I have is with the management. They have no clue on customer service and they do not return any phone calls. I spent over 4 hours one day trying get get an issue solved. I filed a complaint with the Elite Desk and when I called them for an update they said the case was closed. I wish someone from the property would of called me. I left a message for the GM, I believe her name was Tish. I never heard back from them. Not what I expect from a company I have been loyal with for over 19 years.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to review our hotel.  I'm happy to hear you are a valuable Platinum Elite guest, and you found our property to be nice.  I'm very sorry to hear you had an issue at my hotel, and it was difficult to get that issue resolved.  I did not receive a voice mail from any guest during the past 2 weeks; perhaps your call was routed to the incorrect extension.  I would love to receive your feedback directly so that we can improve our service for all guests.  Please feel free to call me at your convenience so that we can discuss your experience.   We very much appreciate your loyalty to Marriott, and I hope to hear from you soon. With kind regards, Tish S.

Summary: First, we didn't get our welcome packet at check-in, as we had the previous night at a Residence Inn in Henderson, NV.  The layout of the Studio Suite didn't allow a guest to remain asleep when someone else turned on the lights in the bathroom.  The ear plugs next to the bed came in very handy whenever anyone was walking in the suite above us. It really did sound lilke someone stomping on the floor.  The cleaning staff was very professional and courteous.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to review our hotel!  Each hotel may be operated slightly different in regards to guest arrival gifts.  Some hotels offer them for Elite members or all guests, some do not.  I apologize you were disappointed upon check-in.  Our hotels also vary in room layout.  My hotel offers a studio suite, which is one large open room without doors in the bedroom area.  Some hotels offer one bedroom suites, which do offer doors to close off the bedroom area.  We also offer the extra large penthouse suites, which are bi-level lofts that are large enough for families of 5-7.  I'm very happy to hear you found the earplugs helpful and our associates professional and courteous!  I hope you will come and stay with us again when you're in the area! With kindest regards, Tish S.

Summary: I just want to say that this place is by far one of thee best Residence Inn we’ve ever stayed in. Our entire family loved every bits of the room. The convenience is all in the package for a family of 5. We appreciated so much of the entire staff being so friendly & most of all attentive to your needs. The breakfast was phenomenal. Love the eggs & their raisins bagel. My only hope that next time we stay, they would warm up the pool a little bit as it was freezing for my baby to dip in. They also have a basketball court which we love so much as my boys can play ball outside. Other than that it’s so awesome. It’s in the middle of everything, you don’t have to drive far. Love it! Thank you guys🙏 we surely come back soon. Keep up the good work! 👍
Manager Response: Thank you so much for taking the time to review the Residence Inn Placentia!  We love hearing feedback from our valued guests.  It’s great to hear you enjoyed our suites, sport court, and full breakfast!  We look forward to seeing you and your family again soon! With kindest regards, Tish S., General Manager

Summary Heading: Stay upstairs and away from the freeway
Summary: Stayed here because I did not want to drive all the way home after a birthday party celebration. The room was clean, well furnished and had everything you would expect from an extended stay suite: Fridge, stove, microwave, sink, small table, dishes, etc. Our room was located close to the freeway offramp and this made for frequent waking. We were below a couple that liked walking back and forth. All this to say the room was not very quiet, in my opinion, and I do not consider myself a light sleeper. If you are here on the weekend expect many families given its proximity to large theme parks. Also, breakfast is free and included, but it was just OK. Again, crowded due to many large families using this budget friendly lodging. I would stay here again because it was clean, but not
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to review our hotel!  We very much appreciate our valued guests offering their honest feedback.  I'm so happy to hear you enjoyed our large suites with a fully equipped kitchen and complimentary hot breakfast.  We look forward to seeing you again hopefully soon. Sincerely, Tish S.

Summary: We stayed here as we were on a family vacation to the Disney area. We choose this place to allow more of us to stay in one room, and the value was great. This allowed us to have all of us together. We stayed in the room with the bed in the loft and two queen beds below. Although the loft bed is great, it's a bit open and there is no real way for privacy in that room, that was a bit disappointing. Parking was easy, free. Breakfast was pretty good, they could have mixed it up a bit, but for the price this was a great value. The reception was great and they got me all checked in, and gave me a free item from the concession area. After a really long drive a few oreos to the family as we walked to the room was great. I would be glad to choose this place again should we return to this
Manager Response: Thanks so much for taking the time to review the Residence Inn Placentia!  We love hearing from our valued guests!  I'm happy you enjoyed our large penthouse suite, complimentary breakfast, and close proximity to Disney.  We look forward to seeing you and your family again soon! With kindest regards, Tish S.

Summary: Fine large big rooms that are dated but fully functional. Staff when we checked in were great. Morning person on the weekend not so much. If I had used the common living room area in our 2 bedroom suite I would have had to change rooms do to the very loud and obnoxious vibrations from the heating system. That needs to be looked at but the bedrooms remained quiet and we all slept very well. The breakfast during the week was much better than the fare that put out on the weekend for some reason. Quite a surprise to see the change, but there was still plenty of food and the service people in the breakfast room are great.  Location is not as convenient to Anaheim Convention Center as I thought it would be - feel further than the 6 miles it is due to traffic and the roads. The hotel
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to review our hotel!  I appreciate your feedback as we are always striving to improve our valued guest's experience with us.  It's very good to hear you had a great experience with our staff and enjoyed our large suites.  I hope you will stay with us again in your future travels to Orange County! With kind regards, Tish S.

Summary: So these suites are very close to Disneyland LA if you are driving. Rooms are quite spacious and have full kitchen. Cleanliness is of high standard and parking is free in very close proximity of your room. There is a small outside pool which is heated and quite relaxing. There are no lifts to first floor suites but the staff are quite helpful and help with heavier luggage. Recommend it.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to review the Residence Inn Placentia!  We love hearing from our guests, and I'm so happy you loved our spacious suites with full kitchens, and our close proximity to Disneyland!  I hope you will come and stay with us again!  With kindest regards, Tish S.

Summary: We stayed here for 1 night while on a family road trip and while visiting family in the local area. The property is located in a bit of a strange area within an office park next to the 57 freeway, however the room was quiet. The room was clean and presentable and the service was efficient, especially the breakfast staff, but the breakfast is so-so. The free WiFi worked, the parking is $5 a day to self park and the room was spacious with my kids sleeping on the sofa bed with sheets and blankets in a bag in the closet, but no pillows ( I picked them up at the front desk). Would I stay here again, may be, but I may check out another property as this one didn’t quite created a wow for myself and my family, but it didn’t disappoint either.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to review our hotel!  We appreciate your feedback and love to hear you enjoyed your quiet suite and complimentary WiFi.  I hope you will stay with us again when you're traveling through Orange County! With kindest regards, Tish S.

Summary Heading: Weekend at Disneyland & California Adventure with kids
Summary: This hotel is your basic Residence Inn.  I booked it through Southwest Vacations with our plane tickets and did my review research and mapping- it seemed like an okay fit- but in the end was not ideal.  Pros:   It includes a basic but hot breakfast and a happy hour (we missed it bc we were at the parks), it has a pool which kids love and there is a kitchen for families who may want to cook or store stuff in the fridge. It has reasonably comfortable beds and a good sized room for a family with 2 kids who can share a sofa bed. If you are travelling with two older/larger kids the sofa bed will be WAY too small.  Cons:   The main issue with THIS location is that on the map it seems not to far from the park, and if you have your own vehicle it is not too bad of a drive. I am not sure
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to review the Residence Inn Placentia!  We love hearing great feedback from our guests.  I'm so happy to hear you enjoyed our complimentary full hot breakfast and our large suites with fully equipped kitchens.  It sounds like you had a wonderful time at Disney, and I hope you will come and stay with us again if you're in the area. With kind regards, Tish S.

Summary: We’ve stayed here for 3 night for a getaway, room was old and outdated, love the kitchen.  When my kids try to open the sofa sleeper it was not done usually it’s made already but it’s ok. When we got the linens from the cabinet the bedsheets was just crumpled on the floor with the blanket don’t know if it’s used or not but it has a lot of hairs on it so we decided to use the plain sheet on the bed too late to disturb housekeeping. Breakfast was good they had different hot foods everyday and attendants were very friendly and helpful. It was not a great stay nor worse just so and so due to no quality inspection before making the room available for guest.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to review our hotel!  I'm very happy to hear you enjoyed our wonderful hot breakfast buffet.  I'm very sorry to hear about the sofa bed linens, and I will share your feedback with my team.  We always strive for a perfect stay for all of our valued guests, but we occasionally fall short of that goal.  I hope you will consider staying with us again in your future travels to Placentia.  I'm very confident you will have a wonderful stay with us.  Happy holidays to you and your family! With kindest regards, Tish S.

Summary: We stayed here from August 22nd to October 4th. It was pleasant, clean and an amazing experience. They served a large hot buffet everyday with new items, housekeeping was wonderful and I always felt like family. They do allow pets, although we dont have any. They have a full kitchen, utensils, dishwasher and nice interior decorating. We had a three bed room, which was two levels and had two bathrooms. We only had housekeeping when we wanted it, which wasnt often. Parking is $5 per night until you are there for 30 nights. Worth every penny. There is a pool, laundry room and basketball court. Loved it here and will definitely go again, if needed! Recommend it!
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to review the Residence Inn Placentia!  We love hearing feedback from our valued guest such as yours.  I'm so happy to hear you enjoyed our fully equipped kitchen, full breakfast, and spacious suites!  Thank you for staying with us, and we look forward to seeing you again soon! With kindest regards, Tish S.

Summary Heading: Too far from Disney and nothing nearby
Summary: I usually love Residence Inns but this hotel is in an industrial area with nothing nearby. Rooms are exterior doors (reminds me of an apartment complex). Our room was on lower level. Room looked clean and even had a fireplace, staff was friendly but I didn’t feel safe so we checked out. Found a great hotel within mile of Disney lot which was surrounded by tons of other hotels and restaurants. I wouldn’t recommend this place. It’s surrounded by industrial bldgs, close to hwy. It just didn’t feel like a vacation place that caters to families. And traffic is horrible everywhere in LA. 15 Miles can take an hour at any time of day!
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to review your experience with us.  I am confident that you would have enjoyed your stay if our hotel had been closer to your destination.  I hope that you will consider staying with us in your future travels to the area! With kindest regards, Tish S.

Summary: Very convenient, very friendly, but price is high for the quality of the Bed. High in the middle and sagging on each side, also very hard. This has not been a problem other times I have stayed here. Breakfast is provided and is good quality; scrambled eggs, briskets and gravy, sausage, coffee.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to review our hotel!  I appreciate your positive feedback regarding our friendly staff and great breakfast!  I'm sorry to hear you found the bed to be uncomfortable.  I hope you will stay with us again in the future so that we can exceed your expectations! With kindest regards, Tish S.

Summary: I stayed at this property as it was reasonably priced and close to Chapman University and surrounding places of interest. parking was free now it's $5 per car. Breakfast was good. Request 2nd floor unit as being on the 1st floor can be sometimes noisier but depends on who is staying above you. I received a late 2pm checkout however our roomkey was deactivated prior to checkout. Why?

Summary Heading: On First Time for one night
Summary: Our first experience with this hotel. To sum it up: Very clean; Friendly employees; separate a/c for every unit; Comfortable beds and great shower; Good breakfast with a great variety: A good experience and they deserve 5 stars.

Summary Heading: Facility was fine - service and attitude was poor.
Summary: This was my 2nd and last stay - both were business related.  My disappointments were driven solely through the attitudes I received when conflicts and issues occurred.  I realize that, by design, Residence Inns aren't really business related, but the location works (worked - I won't go back) for our meetings, so we've been using it when in this area of LA.  Since I wasn't the traditional transient guest, I was therefore an annoyance.  My room & tax was to be paid by my company, but they stated they had no record of it.  They had the contract booking my room as well as the meeting room on the 2nd floor, they confirmed it was reserved for me to use, but they had no form of payment of either room (???)  How is that possible? I was told they would contact my company rep and
Manager Response: Brian E,  Please accept my apology for the issues you experienced during your stay. Your feedback is appreciated and has been reviewed with the hotel leadership team to ensure that this was an isolated incident. I will also follow up with your company to review any communication breakdowns to ensure these do not occur in the future.   Once again, on behalf of the entire staff, please accept our sincere apologies.

Summary: We stayed here as our base to visit Disneyland. Hot tip is its only a $10 to $12 Uber ride from Disneyland cheaper and easier than parking there. The staff are super friendly and accommodating let us check in early so we could get an early start at the park and offered us complimentary breakfast when we arrived and every morning.  Room was very clean and fully stocked with cooking and eating utensils. Whoever designed the reading lights next to the bed should be complimented, they really work and are adjustable. Complimentary newspaper and coffee available at reception. Gas BBQ available and they'll even grocery shop for you! Nice small pool. Sort of out of the way but you can't get better service!

A nice Residence Inn, in (as others have noted) maybe not the best location, although I had no issues.  Just kind of the outskirts of town, not necessarily "seedy". just "light industrial, tired", if that makes any sense.  One of the better breakfast buffets of the many RI's I have stayed in over the years. Close enough to the coast for an afternoon visit.

Clean room, great breakfast, attentive staff, on site laundry room, fire pit and pool, stayed 2 nights with my daughter, quiet even though we were by the pool, HBO, in room kitchen and dinning table, will grocery shop for you. Need I say more.

Summary Heading: A decent RI in a not so good area
Summary: I chose this Hotel as it was the only Marriott property where I could use my free e-cert which is only good at Cat 1-5 Hotels and this one is a Category 4.  This is one of the main reasons why I'll be canceling Marriott credit cards as Cat 1-5 Hotels are becoming scarce making the free certs difficult to use but that is another issue.  As I drove into this property I was already concerned about the area and the safety of my vehicle.  The sign saying management isn't responsible for vehicle theft was a clue that it happens often here.  It's in the middle of an industrial area with office complexes around and the freeway to the side.  At check in they also require you to sign a waver stating you won't have loud parties and you have to put down an extra deposit in case you decide
Manager Response: Chris Y,  Thank you for the feedback regarding your recent stay at our facility. I am sorry to hear about the issues you experienced during your stay in regards to the flat screen display and freeway noise. I am pleased that we were able to successfully relocate you to a quieter location that allowed you to properly rest. My chief engineer has also inspected the aforementioned flat screen to ensure full functionality.  I also want to take a moment to provide clarification on the "liability signage" that is posted in the parking lot. We truly value guest safety at our property and the signage is standard at most hotels that do not charge for parking and not an indicator of an underlying vehicle theft issue.  Once again, thank you for your feedback.

Summary Heading: Good Senior Rate, Location & B'fast Buffet!
Summary: Spent a relaxed 3 nights here; near popular SoCal attractions, good food choices, and freeway access (but not noise). Rooms have complete kitchens, sofa-beds, and comfy kings (but small bath areas). Good for families w/kids; friendly service & attentive staff oversight of breakfast line. Recommended.

Summary Heading: In the middle of industrial area
Summary: I stayed this time with reward points.  Found this hotel with affordable reward points, but Residence Inn itself in many locations are getting old and here was the same. I stayed in 1 king bed suite with a sofa bed. Somehow the cushion of the mattress was bad and the mattress of sofa-bed was horrible. But the staff all around were very friendly and attentive. I may stay here for the  business, but wouldn't bring my family again.
Manager Response: Hahnyc1234,  Thank you for the feedback regarding your recent stay. While I am pleased to know that you found the staff very friendly and accommodating, I am disappointed to hear that you weren't able to enjoy a good night's sleep due to the mattress. Our maintenance staff is conducting a prompt review of the bed and will take necessary steps to ensure this was an  isolated incident. Once again, your feedback is greatly appreciated.

Summary: I was here 3 nights during a work trip in the Anaheim area.  This hotel was convenient.  My room had a wood burning fireplace, fully equipped kitchen, small living area and a very comfortable bed.  The property is laid out in a bunch of multi unit structures. I think each structure had 4 or 6 units.   It was quiet,  I never had issues with noise and the amenities were nice.  The bed was plush and a little on the softer side which I prefer so I slept very well.  Tuesday evening had free wine and small appetizers in the lobby. I believe they had similar other events in the evening throughout the week, but I wasn't available to take advantage.  The morning breakfast was adequate with a few hot options and the normal bagels, toast, cereal, etc. if that's what you wanted.  They also
Manager Response: Brandon,  Thank you for the feedback regarding your recent stay. I am glad to hear we were able to adequately meet your accommodation needs. We look forward to your next visit to the area.

Summary: My honey and I decided to go to California for our anniversary. We spent a few days at Disneyland and one day in LA, this hotel was a perfect place for us. We stayed in the #4 building on the 1st floor, it was a wheelchair accessible so there was only a shower (no tub but not a big deal to us). The suite came with a full kitchen with dishwasher. It was about 30 minute drive from the hotel to disneyland and another to LA. The room itself was very spacious (queen bed suite) and was very clean. We were close to the interstate but we could not hear any noise, not even from the room above us. The staff were all very nice and very helpful with giving directions. The breakfast was hot and helped us get our days started. We stayed for 4 nights.They have free wi-fi or you could pay for
Manager Response: Rosita,  It was truly our pleasure to host you on your trip to the area and I am very pleased to hear that you had a great experience.   We look forward to your next trip!

Summary: Stayed during the last week of December 2016 for a conference. The staff was very warm and courteous. The location itself was average at best. Our suite (building 5) was right next to the freeway and if you are a light sleeper, you might want to ask for a suite far far away. The noise from the freeway was way too loud. Also, I wish the loft design was enclosed and not open which would allow for more privacy.
Manager Response: Alfred T,  Please accept my sincere apologies for the noise issues that you experienced during your stay. Please don't hesitate to contact me personally on your next visit to the area so I can ensure a quiet location away from the freeway.

Summary Heading: Great Place to stay for a Disney Trip
Summary: We stayed here for a Disney trip using marriot points. Was happy with the distance from Disneyland, maybe a 10-15 minute drive. Room was clean and large. Breakfast was great, had a good selection and all members of our party were happy.
Manager Response: funk014,  Thank you for the feedback regarding your recent stay at the Residence Inn Anaheim Placentia Fullerton. It is always a pleasure to hear that we were able to meet the needs and expectations of our guests.  We look forward to your next visit to the area.

Summary: We stayed at the residence Inn because it was close to my son's condo and the graduation site. The suite we got accommodated all six of us with no problem. It had 2 bath rooms and a loft with kitchen. The hotel also provides a daily free breakfast which was our decision maker to stay their.  Very nice and clean , great staff and close to everything including a sams club, Walmart in and out burger and Jack in the box. There is a very nice place to eat close called Tom's place which was very nice and inexpensive. Give this hotel a 2 thumbs. Up.
Manager Response: bmitc,  Thank you for the positive feedback regarding your stay at the Residence Inn Anaheim Placentia Fullerton.   From myself and the staff, we want to wish your son a safe and happy journey on his career in law enforcement!

Summary Heading: Perfect Choice for SoCal Attractions and Front Desk very helpful!
Summary: I just wanted to say how much my family and I enjoyed staying at the Residence Inn at Placentia for a Disneyland vacation. As a gold Marriott Rewards member I appreciated the fact that Stephanie at the front desk was so kind and helpful. She even recognized my rewards status and was able to upgrade us to a suite. I can't tell you how great it was to be able to come back to the hotel at the end of a full and long day at Disneyland and to be able to have sufficient space to unwind and relax after fighting the overwhelming crowds at the park. Once again, kudos to Stephanie and to all the members of your staff who helped make our visit to California so enjoyable and memorable for my kids. We will be back!
Manager Response: smithdbs03,  It was a pleasure hosting you and your family. We look forward to your next visit to the SoCal area.

Summary: Althought the Res Inn is basically behind The Bruery and you could throw a rock and hit the building, there is a fence between the two properties. It is scaleable, but after a lot of beer, one might use caution. If you walk around the fence, it is about a 15 minute walk.   A category 4 (20,000 pts) hotel, this property checked the box for my specific need. It was in proximity of The Bruery (for safely walking back to hotel) and it had a bed. Clean spaces, fine area.
Manager Response: RyanP_KC  I just want to thank you for the discussion point on the Bruery and let you know that we are currently reviewing ways to make the establishment more accessible by foot for our guests.  Your feedback is greatly appreciated and feel free to reach out to me for any updates regarding accessibility to the Bruery.

Summary Heading: Might End Up Being a Very Expensive Stay if You Have an SUV!
Summary: We stayed 2 nights(Disney Trip) and the room and staff was excellent. If just rating the room and staff I encountered I would give 4 stars. Only 6 miles from Disney which is a huge plus.  My issue was with the fact the staff knew there has been some break ins in the parking lot but yet never said a word to warn anyone. In my case, I’m not sure that would have helped as last thing I’d expect to get stolen was seats out of the vehicle.  There is a sign in the parking area saying something of the nature "not responsible for break ins and to lock/secure your valuables", that should have been my first sign of a possible problem.   Nothing like waking up to go pack ones truck and seeing the back window pried open then opening the hatch to find the seats missing. Manager was prompt in
Manager Response: Mr. Greig,  As communicated in my email, I sincerely empathize with your unfortunate situation. We have never experienced an issue of this nature during my time at the property and have extremely minimal instances of crimes reported during the last few years.   In light of your experience, we have put protocol in place to ensure this was an isolated incident. In addition to the routine patrols that local law enforcement performs of our facilities, we have added additional staff to monitor parking areas.   Your feedback was greatly appreciated.

Summary Heading: Good choice for SoCal Attractions Visit
Summary: Redeemed Marriott Points for two night stay - great value and no parking fee ! Check-in and Check-out were both fast and friendly.  A listing of local recommended restaurants with brief directions was provided.   Room was modern and clean.  Nights were comfortable and quiet.
Manager Response: G P,  I am pleased to hear that you had a great experience at the Residence Inn Anaheim Placentia Fullerton. Please don't hesitate to contact myself or a member of the staff to book your accommodations when planning your next visit to the area.

Summary: Great hotel 10 mins from Disney, room was large, well equipped with kitchen including dishwasher and even the pullout couch bed was decent , king size was super comfortable.   Breakfast has a large variety of good food . All the Staff was friendly and helpful especially Ramona in the breakfast room. Pool area was clean, comfortable seating . They even had free dinner and drinks with their mix and mingle for a few nights of our stay . Quiet location but close enough to the action
Manager Response: Rob,  Thank you for the positive feedback regarding your stay at the Residence Inn Anaheim Placentia Fullerton. I will convey your comments to the staff as it truly takes a team effort to provide each and every guest with a memorable experience.

Summary: 15 minutes from Disneyland. Rooms with 3 queen beds to accommodate families. Helpful, friendly staff. Rooms were a little dated, but were clean. We stayed in the suite with a loft. Really enjoyed the pool. Thumbs up!
Manager Response: Stacey L,  It was our pleasure hosting you and your family on your visit to Disneyland. It gives myself and the staff great pride whenever we receive positive feedback. I will be sure to share your warm comments with everyone.

Summary: My son and I stayed her for 3 nights in July 2015. We booked using points. We booked a studio and  as a gold member they upgraded us to bi-level loft suite. The room had one bedroom downstairs, living room, kitchen and a upstairs loft bedroom. There was a bathroom upstairs and a bathroom downstairs. The room was clean and looked to be recently renovated.   We found the staff to be friendly and super accommodating. We never made it to breakfast.   We visited Disney each day and found this location to be quick and easy (aprx 10 -15mins) and we could use surface streets or the freeway.   As a women alone with a teenage son, I felt very safe at this location. My only complaint is the outside stairs and no elevator!
Manager Response: Shanola,  Thank you for the kind comments regarding your stay at the Residence Inn Anaheim Placentia Fullerton. Whenever possible we always upgrade our guests and I'm glad to hear that we were able to provide you with a Family Suite to fit your needs.   We look forward to your next visit to the area.

Summary: I loved the residence, it's so clean. We took the two bedroom residence with two bathrooms, a living room with a sofa bed and a small kitchen with a dish washer and a cooker. The staff there are so friendly. There's a swimming pool and a laundry room. It's suitable for big families and small ones. I totally recommend it.
Manager Response: Syd,  Thank you for the kind comments regarding your stay at the Residence Inn Anaheim Placentia Fullerton. Our goal is to provide a home away from home for all of our guests. It was a pleasure serving you and your family.

Summary: They messed up our reservation again! (I think this company has a habit of doing this). We call them directly to book our reservation because of the problem we had at Costa Mesa Residence Inn the week before hoping this will eliminate that but NO! The excuse that we get from Costa Mesa is they have a problem with their website. So we call and spoke with a REAL PERSON! But still they messed it up! We even call before we left San Francisco to make sure because we will be coming late. Driving 6 1/2 hours from San Francisco to Fullerton arriving almost midnight and everyone is tired and when you get there they gave us the wrong room! We had to make use of what we can in the room they gave us. And there's more. We are about to sleep and there is this "ticking" sound coming from one
Manager Response: Ramsidel,  I sincerely apologize for the issues that you experienced when booking via Marriott central reservations. It was my pleasure to speak with you regarding the incident and compensate you for not only the inconvenience.   In the future, please feel free to reach out to myself or a member of our property directly when booking to avoid any confusion.

Summary: We stayed here for a family trip to Disneyland, it wasn't as close as I was thinking it would be when I booked. I think the Marriott website said it was only 4 miles away from Disneyland and it ended up being closer to 7. Not a big deal, but there are hotels at similar price points much closer to the park, something to consider. But this was obviously my fault for not google mapping it ahead of time, but it really wasnt a big deal. The room was nice except the bathroom, the light was out, and the door hit the toilet when you opened/closed it. The breakfast was the standard continental residence in breakfast. The staff was nice and overall good experience, but just average as far as other residence inn's I have stayed at.   I did stay here using points, so this stay was free, if
Manager Response: Daniel C,  As we are always looking for ways to improve the guest experience at our property, your feedback regarding your recent stay is greatly appreciated. I would like to apologize for the room issue you experienced in regards to the bathroom light.   I would also like to inform you that Residence Inn is in the process of upgrading its breakfast program. This exciting upgrade will kick off in July 2016. The new breakfast program will expand the current offerings and include many new healthy options.  Once again, thank you for your feedback.

Summary: very nice stay, for 6 weeks yet, the hotel was under renovation which caused a few issues but all in all went smoothly, Bldg 5 is adjacent to the highway so it is a bit noisy in the room I had, the staff at this hotel was incredibly helpful and very nice, the 3 day a week hospitality events were great, I would recommend this hotel to anyone , especially for extended stays
Manager Response: travelerJoe2014,  I know a renovation can be quite uncomfortable for travelers so I'm glad that overall your 6 week stay was smooth. I would like to let you know that the renovation has been completed and we are very excited.  We would to host your next trip to the area and showcase the improvements. Please contact us ahead of your next visit.

Summary: I've always appreciated the extra space you get when staying at a Residence Inn. Check in was a breeze despite it being very late.  Having a kitchen is a big plus, especially the full-size refrigerator and microwave. The toilet/shower room is a bit tight, but the extra vanity space and closets were good. The sofa bed was decent in the studio room.   The pool was a bit too chilly for us to use though and there was no hot tub either. Breakfasts were great with nice options, although there was a wider variety on Monday versus the weekend.  No restaurants within walking distance but lots of options nearby within a 5-10 minute drive.  Overall, a comfortable space to lay our heads down and close enough to Disneyland as well.
Manager Response: wrldtrvlr8374,  Thank you for the positive feedback regarding your stay that the Residence Inn Anaheim Placentia Fullerton. Our suites are designed for families just like yours that require extra space and full kitchens to fit their needs.   I am glad you were able to enjoy Disneyland on your trip to the area. We look forward to your next visit!

Summary Heading: 11 nights and not a real complaint
Summary: Located near railyards but with a large business and a Quality Inn standing between us and the trains, which we never heard.   If you have stayed in a RI you know that breakfast is included.  Ours were great, eggs, waffles, fried potatos, choice of 4 cereals fruit, OJ muffins etc and the food never ran low.   On only two nights did we hear neighbors moving in upstairs.   the staff was helpful and courteous.  only used the pool once as we were always out late returning from San Diego, Hollywood, Long Beach or disneyland, and the pool was clean and in the high 70s as its heated.   RIs have full kitchens, fridge, stove, mw, sink, dishwasher and a large assortment of dishes and pots and utensils.
Manager Response: artj377,  It was a pleasure hosting you at our facility for 11 nights. I'm am glad to know you enjoyed our breakfast assortment and also want to let you know that Residence Inn will be upgrading our breakfast offerings in August 2016 to give our guests even more options.  Please feel free to contact me ahead of your next stay

Summary: Pleasant grounds...nice landscaping by pool and small tennis courts. Very friendly, attentive, personable clerks at front desk (Yuri I remember)..and friendly, outgoing Maria and Mona (?name) setting out each day/night the food. A "just-like-home" layout of 2 story-condos. We stayed in "block" room 423..everything in working order..all utensils/wine glasses/plates/stove/fridge/plates etc needed..and of course a coffeemaker and a nice touch-one bag of microwave p-corn. Mattress was a tad too soft for hubby and I..but comfy.Smallish bathroom  with separate vanity. Free parking..and the best amenities were the full breakfast each a.m. (waffles/eng muffin/eggs/sausage/fruits/yogurt  etc) and the great "mixer" 6p-730pm Mon-Wed. with complimentary beer, wine, and appetizers. My only 2
Manager Response: Ca Mama,  It was a pleasure to host you and your family at the Residence Inn Anaheim Placentia Fullerton. I am pleased to hear that our apartment style layout and amenities met all of your needs.   I will be sure to recognize Yuri, Maria, and Ramona for providing excellent customer service during your stay.   We look forward to your next visit to the area.

Summary Heading: Not a bad place to stay
Summary: I chose this hotel on a business trip because the hotel I normally stay in was booked solid.  This hotel turned out to be only minutes away from where I normally stay.  Arriving at the Residence Inn, I parked near the office and wandered in.   I was greeted in a fair amount of time and the checkin process was painless.  My next step was finding my room.  This property is a large square and you need to locate your building and room and park close to it.  After finding my place, I parked and heaved my luggage up the stairs to the second floor room.  Very spacious.  There is a large kitchen area, a living room area, a bedroom and a bath area.  The room was very clean and well-organized.  The bed in my room was comfortable and I was pleased with the amenities.    Around 10PM on the
Manager Response: Gargamel,  I am pleased that we were able to provide you with accommodations during a period when your regular hotel could not. We welcome new guests with open arms and are always excited to establish new relationships.  Please feel free to contact me directly for any of your future hotel needs as I am here to personally assist you.

Summary Heading: Only OK for a Marriott Residence Inn
Summary: We stayed for one night on Tuesday, March 22nd.  We arrived for a late check in - about 10PM.  We were told that we had been upgraded to a suite.  The reality was the hotel was packed.  Almost no place to park.  The "upgrade" was in the back of the hotel up two flights of stairs. Overlooking the back of the surrounding hotel road and parking lot. The room smelled like no one had been in it for a very long time.  I am sure that our original room was given away.  Although we are Gold Elite members,  this seemed to matter not. I looked for a window to open without success.  Everything did SEEM clean. Without a window to open we were forced to sleep in that  terrible smell.   At breakfast I told the staff person at the front desk the problem with the smell.  She was not receptive.
Manager Response: BostonBubbles,  I would like to apologize for your guest experience at our property.    I have noted all of the issues that you have brought forward in your response and will meet directly with my hotel leadership team to ensure that this was an isolated experience.  Once again, please accept my sincere apologies.

Summary: We stayed at many residence inns, and this is different from other residence inn we visited. The hotel layout is really casual, with several units in each building. Inside each unit is like typical residence inn, except it has some features like light sensors or electronic temp control. It has a good swimming pool and a nice tennis court, but we used neither of these. In the 5 days of our stay, we visited Disneyland, as well as "little taipei" in Rowland Heights. They are both in close distance.  PRO: 1. Clean room, good kitchen. 2. Very friendly clerks. 3. great breakfast included 4. great location to Disney, about 15 minutes drive 5. Good wi-fi  CONS 1. not sound proof, we can hear kids running upstairs 2. utensils are not clean - we have to wash them over
Manager Response: Raymond S  Thank you for the feedback about your recent stay at the Residence Inn Anaheim Placentia Fullerton. The layout of our property does differ from that of other Residence Inns. We have an apartment style layout that truly provides the feeling of home for our guests.   I am glad to hear that you and your family were able to visit a few of the many attractions that are in close proximity to our location.  Please don't hesitate to contact a member of our hotel team to book your next visit to the area.

Summary: The staff at the hotel were very friendly and helpful.  Disneyland is short drive and it was nice to have a full kitchen to cook in.  There is also a beer brewery within walking distance.  My husband really enjoyed that after a long day at Disney.  The rooms were nice and the pool area was wonderful.  The only thing missing was a hot tub.
Manager Response: MJS2005,  Thank you for the feedback regarding your recent stay at the Residence Inn Anaheim Placentia Fullerton. It was our pleasure to host you and your family. It is also nice to know that you enjoyed our newly renovated guest rooms and updated pool facilities.   I will be sure to share your kind comments with the entire staff. We look forward to your next visit to the area!

Summary: Stayed here with my family while visiting the Anaheim area. We did an Angels game, Disney Land, and other sight seeing. This hotel was amazing. We had the 2 bedroom, one room with 2 beds and a full bath, full kitchen and living area with TV. Then lofted upstairs was the master bedroom with 1 bed,TV and full bath. Totally loved the set up. Free breakfast every morning in the lobby was delicious. They had 2 waffle makers with toppings (chocolate chips, strawberries,whipped cream) and then different hot items depending on the day ( eggs, sausage, bacon, hash browns) coffee and juice. It was very good, well taken care of. I was very impressed with the breakfast staff. Pool was small but never crowded. Basketball hoop next to it. Small fitness area. The area around there looks a
Manager Response: Cubsrays90,  I am glad you enjoyed your stay at the Residence Inn Anaheim Placentia Fullerton! We take great pride in knowing that we were able to provide such a positive experience for you and your family! It is our mission to make each and every stay feel like a home away from home.   We look forward to serving you on your next visit to the area.

Summary: About half of the rooms are unavailable due to renovation meaning that some of them are on the outer ring of rooms exposing them to the highway (noisy and felt unsafe). That said, after staying a couple of time in the last month, there are some plusses. Choose a room close to the front of the property. breakfast and evening receptions are fantastic. rooms are dated but clean. staff is very nice. parking is easy and available. There is no walking to dinner or anything because of the location so plan on making a short drive for food. they do have a small offering of food and beverages in the front which will meet your needs if you want something small. there is a nice pool area and bball court in addition to laundry machines.
Manager Response: Wagsells,  Thank you for providing feedback on your recent stay at our property. I sincerely apologize for any inconvenience you may have experienced while we are under renovation. This renovation will provide a complete upgrade of our guestrooms to address the dated feeling that you mentioned.   I am pleased to know that your previous visits were enjoyable and that you were able to attend the Residence Inn Mix that is provided Monday - Wednesday. It gives our staff and guests an opportunity to network.   I would love the opportunity to serve you again once your travels bring you back to Placentia, so please don't hesitate to contact a member of our staff or myself directly ahead of your next visit.

Summary: Starting off, the hotel had great rooms.  I like the size, and everything you get with it.  That's about it for the pros.  The cons - The water in the shower doesn't get too hot, the only thing the cleaning staff does is straighten your room, make the bed, and sometimes refresh the towels.  They do not give you refills on the shampoo or any other bathroom items, unless you ask.  The air was working on/off, didn't always stay on as I would have liked it to. The location isn't very good.  There aren't many places to eat right around it (There are some places within 1.5 - 2 miles, bout outside of Placentia.) The staff at the front desk were extremely helpful when there was a billing issue.  I would say this place is okay to sleep at, but it wouldn't be my preferred choice.
Manager Response: Patrick P,  Your comments provide insight on ways to improve the guest experience at our property and are points well taken. Rest assured, I will follow-up on all issues and suggestions to correct any shortcomings moving forward. If you have any further questions or concerns, please feel free to contact me.

Summary Heading: Horrible staff a tire property under construction
Summary: Arrived at the property and everything was ok, checked in and was told the property was completely sold out and I was like "whoa, this place is jammin!" But upon driving around the property to our building it was apparent there was major renovation going on, something that wasn't disclosed on Marriotts website, in confirmations, or verbally when we checked in, and 75% of the parking was taken by construction. Ok our second day we were woken by hammering and a electric saw outside our door. Called the front desk around 7:45 and asked why the construction started early (sign in lobby says 9am-6pm) and was told those signs are wrong that construction is 6am-9pm. Who schedules construction for those hours? Went back and tried to go back to sleep, and it must have happened because
Manager Response: John T,  Thank you for the feedback regarding your recent stay at our facility. Please accept our sincere apologies that it was not communicated to you that we are conducting a guestroom upgrade. Although our property has an apartment style layout that limits disruptions during improvements of this nature, we do realize that some guests may experience discomfort. I regret that you were not made aware of these changes prior to your reservation.   Once the upgrade is completed, the property will have a refreshed feel that is in accordance with the high level of quality that Marriott guests have grown to expect.  Once again, we apologize for the lapse in communication.

Summary Heading: House cleaning details inadequate/Good front desk and kitchen hospitality.
Summary: We're Marriott members, so we try to stay at the most reasonable price Residence Inn/Fairfield Inn when in our vacation area. We stayed over the New Years eve week,   We were a little disappointed on this visit. We were not aware this a pet friendly facility and upon entry to our room, it smelled like urine with an overdose of cleaning chemicals. We immediately contacted the front desk and they gave us the key to an adjacent room. We moved to the new room immediately. Luckily this room did not have an offensive odor.   Upon settling into our new room, we set up the pull out for our children and laid out the  blanket that were in the closet and found the sheet and blanket with human hair. We immediately contacted the front desk to notify them and they brought us out a fresh set
Manager Response: Thank you for the feedback regarding your stay. I would like to sincerely apologize for the housekeeping issues you experienced while at our property. We hold ourselves to a very high standard so it is disappointing to hear that standard was not met in this particular instance.   I have shared this feedback with property leadership to ensure that this was an isolated incident that will be corrected moving forward.   If you have any additional issues or concerns, please feel free to contact the hotel directly.

Summary: My parents chose this hotel as it had a separate living area in the loft for me, and although it was away from Harbour Blvd and Disney, I'm glad they did. We arrived and checked in to our apartment (#1422), the parking was available near the room so it was easy to get everything out of the car. The room - this was so spacious, they had everything you could think of - living area with sofa and chair, eating area with table and chairs, kitchen with full size fridge freezer, dishwasher, cooker, microwave, coffee maker and pots and pans (they even supplied microwave popcorn!). There was then a room downstairs and my room on the mezzanine floor (both with en-suite bathrooms). Meet and Greet Mingle - This happened in the breakfast area on Monday-Wednesday and was nibbles and drinks.
Manager Response: TomassoJ,  I am very pleased to hear that your parents had an enjoyable stay at our facility. We strive to create a "home away from home" atmosphere for all of our guests. Your feedback is greatly appreciated.

Summary Heading: Good place for quick or extended stay
Summary: This is a great and quiet property with the comforts of home.  Nothing like having the ability to cook for yourself while on the road if you choose with a fully equipped kitchen. Also breakfast is served daily as part of your stay along with a welcome reception daily Mon - Wed.  The rooms are clean and spacious and are well lit. The rooms appear to have recently under gone some renovations.  Overall everything is in great shape.   Note: The property does have limited parking so if you arrive late, you may have to park and walk back to room.  So pull over close to your room, put on your hazard lights, unload the car, park, and enjoy the exercise. Sweet Dream!
Manager Response: LoneTrvlr,  Thank you for your kind compliments regarding your recent stay at the Residence Inn Anaheim Placentia Fullerton. We actually have not undergone a renovation yet but are slated to begin in January of 2016. Your statement regarding the rooms are a testament to our housekeeping staff, who work tremendously hard to keep our rooms fresh and clean.  Once again thank you and best regards!

Summary: We reserved a studio king but when we walked in, it reeked of air freshener, and we are chemically sensitive, so had to change to an $80 more expensive king with loft room. It smelled moldy and musty, but we needed to stop for the night, so we plugged in our two portable air cleaners, set them on high and left to grab pizza. Upon returning, we noticed how filthy the carpet was with stains and spots.  There was hair in the sheets, and I slept in a sleeping bag liner with my own pillow on top of the bed so I didn't have to touch the gross sheets.  We brought a small French bulldog who stayed in his crate, and paid $100 extra for him. Maybe they should use the expensive pet fee to clean the carpets and maintain the rooms. I have never written a negative review like this, but it was
Manager Response: Laurie A,  Thank you for taking the time to offer feedback on your recent visit to our property.  As we pride ourselves on delivering a memorable hotel experience during your travels, we have unfortunately fallen short of our goal during your recent stay. Please accept our sincere apology . I have shared your feedback with the appropriate team members to ensure that this is an isolated incident.   Upholding our commitment to provide a memorable experience with exceptional service, we hope to have an opportunity to better your experience in future.

Summary: Very handy for 'The Bruery' Nice hotel, basic, clean, spacious. Friendly and helpful staff too Good in room amenities Good access to/from I5 Easy parking, and free. Free wifi too. Nice laundry as it is set up for longer stays
Manager Response: Hawk345,  Thank you for sharing your experience at the Residence Inn Anaheim Placentia/Fullerton.  With a mission to provide superior customer service, we take great pride in serving your needs and are delighted to hear that we have met your expectations. Your feedback will be shared with the team to continue to inspire and motivate them to deliver exceptional customer service.   Thank you for staying at the Residence Inn Anaheim Placentia/Fullerton and we hope you choose to stay with us again whenever your travel needs bring you back to Placentia.

Summary: This is a great location for Orange County attractions, Disneyland and Knotts Berry Farm. The facility is clean, friendly and convenient for both John Wayne and Ontario airports. In room kitchen, laundry facility on site and plenty of parking.
Manager Response: SharmHaynes,  Thank you for sharing your experience at the Residence Inn Anaheim Placentia/Fullerton.  We appreciate your feedback and are delighted to hear that you had a great stay. With a spirit to serve, we take great pride in not only meeting, but exceeding your expectations.   Your feedback is integral to our ability to continue to improve our service. Thank you again for your time and come visit us again soon!

Summary: We were looking for a two bedroom option to stay at while in Disneyland.  Having older teens, we've found that we all travel better with space.  This was the best option I could find without buying two rooms.  Our room had a good size bedroom/bathroom, living room and kitchen area.  Then upstairs was a loft with a queen bed and another bathroom.  The beds were firm but not uncomfortable and the room was clean. This worked great for us. The furnishings were nice as was the pool area. One drawback was that we had to carry our luggage upstairs so that may not work for everyone. I saw multiple barbecues available to travelers.  We also appreciated the free wifi (which worked well) and free parking which you don't find as often closer to Disneyland.  The free breakfast included
Manager Response: TrudyTraveler,  On behalf of the entire staff of the Residence Inn Anaheim Placentia/Fullerton, we truly enjoyed hosting you on your visit to the area. I am pleased to know that our property was able meet all of your expectations! We look forward to your next visit.

Summary: I took bentahouse room.it was good for us .they are cleaning every day.there is acar parking ,swimming bool and pq area.the location near disney area.calm place. Non smoking room.no elevator needed.there are washing machine inside the hotel my wife prefer this
Manager Response: 304talals  Thank you for the feedback regarding your stay at the Residence Inn Anaheim Placentia/Fullerton. I am pleased to hear that you enjoyed all the amenities at our property and were able to take advantage of the spacious accommodations of the Penthouse Suites. Our Bi-Level Suites are perfectly tailored for families like yours.  We look forward to your next visit to the area.

Summary: I think the only reason this place is surviving is because of friendly staff. Otherwise there are plenty of reasons to hate it - Bad location Bad sofa bed - Its neither comfortable to sleep nor sit Very old property  Expensive  Bad breakfast
Manager Response: NBA555,  I want to thank you for your feedback and say that I am sorry to hear you had anything less than an exceptional stay while at our property. I would like to also take this opportunity to inform you that we are slated to begin a renovation in November 2015. We would love another opportunity to showcase our product after completion so please feel free to contact myself or a trusted team member when planning your next visit to the area.

Summary: Consistent experience at the Residence Inn hotels. I am a big fan of Residence Inn brand and have been staying at different properties. This was my 1st stay at this hotel. The rooms are very nice and spacious. Complimentary breakfast was good. If they can add some more vegetarian options in the breakfast that can be very good. One more thing i found that the timing for Residence Mix here is only for 30 minutes while for other properties i have been staying is 2 hours.
Manager Response: MalpaniM,  Thank you for your feedback regarding your recent visit to the Residence Inn Anaheim Placentia/Fullerton. I am glad to hear you had a pleasant stay. Also, with healthy food options on the minds of many of our travelers, your request that we look into vegetarian items will definitely be researched. It is our mission to provide a top notch experience from check in to check out and food options play a huge role. We look forward to your next visit.

Summary: This hotel was a great surprise. The 2 bedroom was very modern and we had plenty of space. The complimentary breakfast every morning was also very good, a good variety of food and well kept. The staff was very nice. Took advantage of the pool and basketball hoop every night
Manager Response: Kevin P,  Thank you for your kind comments regarding your stay at the Residence Inn Anaheim Placentia/Fullerton. As we pride ourselves on providing a memorable guest experience, it is a pleasure to know your stay was enjoyable. We look forward to your next visit.

Summary: The rooms are very nice and spacious with almost a loft feel. The kitchen was just the perfect size with a stove, dishwasher, microwave and refrigerator. The beds were super comfortable. Every morning we went down to the lobby for the complimentary breakfast and met our expectations with a variety of food and a waffle maker!
