The two ladies who made the breakfast every morning were friendly and talked to us. The pool is a tad small but wasn't crowded in the mornings or evenings.
Manager Response: Travelingkirst33,  Thank you for the kind words regarding our breakfast staff. The two ladies you mentioned have been key pieces of the Residence Inn Anaheim Placentia Fullerton for many years who take great pride in providing an excellent guest experience. I will share your gracious comments with them. We look forward to your next visit.

Summary: This is a roomy, comfortable hotel. Weather forced us to change our plans, and the hotel found a great room for us at a moment's notice. The staff was very friendly and helpful. The breakfast was better than I have had at other properties. Overall, a great experience.
Manager Response: Kathy K,  I am pleased to know that you had a positive experience during your stay at the Residence Inn Anaheim Placentia Fullerton. We take great pride in knowing that your stay was a success and look forward to your next visit.

Summary: Although this property is older, it was well maintained.  Housekeeping was very good compared to most properties that are older.  We stayed in a family suite that had good sized rooms.  The bedroom had two queen beds and an average size bathroom.  Upstairs loft like bedroom had its own bathroom.  I would guess the furnishings had been renovated 6 or 7 years prior.  My only complaint was that the air conditioning vent blew directly at the loft bed (fine if you like that direct blast), but it was a bit much for me.  I like cool, but not directly blowing on my head while sleeping.  It was not adjustable, but should be.  Breakfast was the usual breakfast bar set up - not outstanding food, but the normal expectation.  The ladies who were servicing the breakfast were especially nice
Manager Response: Seveut,  Thank you for your feedback regarding your stay at the Residence Inn Anaheim Placentia/Fullerton. It is our mission to uphold the Marriott Tradition of making every guest experience memorable. Our team takes great pride in hearing your stay was pleasurable.   I also want to inform you that the property will be undergoing a renovation this Fall that will ensure the hotel is in prime condition for our travelers. We look forward to hosting you again when your travels bring you to the area.

Summary: The bathroom is needing a good cleaning. The rest of the room is good and the bed was comfortable. The sofa bed was not....that was bad news. The gym has old machines and no Lysol wipes, even when asked to get some. The staff is very friendly and very accommodating overall. The breakfast is free and coffee is good.
Manager Response: Fun2Day13,  Thank you for taking the time to offer feedback in regards to your recent stay at the Residence Inn Anaheim Placentia/Fullerton.   As we pride ourselves on delivering a memorable hotel experience to each guest, I would like to apologize for any inconveniences you experienced during your stay. The Residence Inn Anaheim Placentia will begin a renovation of our guest rooms in November 2015.   This renovation will address the issues you mentioned in your review.  We hope to have an opportunity to better your experience with us whenever your travels bring you back to Placentia. Please feel free to contact me directly at anytime.

Summary: A very unpleasant stay.  We were scheduled to stay two nights and checked out after one.  Did not get much sleep here as we were awake from 1-3 PM with the very large party that woke us up.  It was really throughout the complex from what we could hear, large groups up and down the stairs and shouting voices.  When checking out we were told that they had a form signed where the guests agreed not to behave that way, guess that should have been a clue that there was a problem?  Otherwise the room was in pretty sad condition, and you could see light through the door jam. Breakfast was tasteless and below average for our experience at other extended stay hotels we have stayed at this year.
Manager Response: Sue50731,  Thank you for your feedback regarding your stay at our property. I sincerely apologize for any inconvenience you encountered during your visit. We work very hard to assure every guest has a comfortable, hassle free experience and unfortunately we fell short of that goal. We would love the opportunity to accommodate you again when your travels bring you to the area. Please don't hesitate to contact me directly ahead of your next visit.

Summary: Overall great. The location wasn't bad... we were a Disneyland crowd and it might have been nice to be in walking distance, but we didn't just do Disney so the location was great for overall. We had a penthouse suite and it was huge and awesome. Well kept. The only "complaint" I have is that the breakfast area was really small and crowded, especially on Saturday with the Disney crowd.
Manager Response: Sue507231,  I would like to sincerely apologize for issues you experienced while at the Residence Inn Placentia. We pride ourselves on delivering consistent, memorable service to each guest and unfortunately we have fallen short of our goal.   We have policies and practices in place to limit noise but in light of your feedback, I will be reviewing the procedures to enhance our noise policy.   Please feel free to contact me directly if your travels bring you to the area again.

Summary: We stayed here with some members of my sales team.  The suite was excellent and they loved the full kitchen.  Fantastic! The Staff was very friendly and helped issue room cards to everyone arriving at different times.  Thank you!!
Manager Response: Project S,  I am pleased to hear that your stay at the Residence Inn Anaheim Placentia/Fullerton was a success and that  our suites met the expecations of your sales team. Don't hesitate to contact us if any future business needs arise that will bring you and your team to the area again! It was our pleasure hosting you.

Summary: I stayed here the night before my wedding with my groomsmen (so that I would be in a different hotel than my wife to be).  We really enjoyed this hotel and the big rooms that went along with it.  They even gave me a congratulations card as I was checking out in the morning.
Manager Response: Atl10braves,  Getting married is an extremely important life event so we take pride in knowing that our staff at the Residence Inn Anaheim Placentia/Fullerton was able to provide a positive guest experience before your big day. On behalf of myself and the entire staff, we wish you and your bride a huge congratulations!

Summary Heading: Many perks!!! Great value!!! EXCELLENT breakfast! Good for Disney stays.
Summary: We stayed here the entire week of March 16th, 2015 for a trip from North Carolina to Disneyland/CA sightseeing. Staying in a hotel for the entire week with my husband and a very energetic 5 year-old, I was slightly concerned that we would feel cramped and irritable by the end of the week, but I must say that the staff and housekeeping team really made the difference in making our stay a very welcoming one. Housekeeping came by DAILY and made our beds and left us lots of extra clean towels. You must understand the feeling of bliss when you come home from a long day at Disney and find that you can just jump on your neatly-made made bed and relax, and then have clean towels to shower with. What I especially liked was that they even fixed the sofa bed daily for us, and had it all

We stayed at this hotel on a trip to Disneyland.  The studio was spacious and it was nice to have a refrigerator available for cold drinks.  The bed was comfortable and the room was clean.  A couple of weird quirks; the under cabinet lights in the kitchen were motion activated so if you got out of bed at night the lights in the kitchen would come on.  Also, the bathroom was so small you have to stand to the side of the toilet in order to close the door.  The continental breakfast was good each morning and it was nice to have a variety of food and not the same thing every day.  The hotel is about a 5-10 minute drive to Disneyland and is in a business park area near Hwy 91 and 57.

Summary Heading: A crowded but with very friendly staffs
Summary: During the holiday season, the hotel was full of customers, but the services remain in a very good quality.  From the front desk to house keeping, all the staffs are nice & friendly. They gave you a very joyful stay.  The breakfast was good.  The room was clean & tidy.

The overall property is nice.  It's in a bit of an out of the way in a small corporate park.  Staff was friendly.  Room was okay overall except for one item.  We were in a studio with a king and pull out couch.  The bed on the couch was horrible.  It literately was metal springs with a piece of cloth on it.  We had to talk to the hotel & they have us some foam rubber to put on top of it.  It helped a bit, but was still terrible for sleeping.  The sheets / blanket were in bad shapes & had dirt in the bag it came in.  Overall, if you're using just the bed, you'll be fine.  If the pull out bed, be warned.
Manager Response: Hi and thank you for your valuable input.  I apologize for the condition of your sofa bed mattress. We are changing all of the sofa's in 2015 during our upcoming renovation and are currently replacing the mattresses that are in poor condition.

Summary Heading: Older hotel but well maintained and great value.
Summary: Spent one night and surprised with a VERY good, full breakfast with eggs, sausage, cereals, juices, etc. AND a full dinner that night.  Dinner was spaghetti and salad, bread, etc. with unlimited portions and FREE beer and wine (red and white).  TREMENDOUS value!

Everything was great from Sujei checking me into a clean nice room all the way too check out. I was here for 3 days and breakfast was very delicious and had a great variety. Thank you residence Inn. I will return when im back in the area.
Manager Response: Thank you so much for your kind review of our hotel and staff.  I have passed your feedback on to Sujei along with my appreciation for a job well done.

Summary: Bugs in sheets.Watched maid drop towels and take upstairs to room. Dirt blood on toilet mold white fluid on sofa Horrible Management and staff and it took an hour to get checked in. Its in the middle of an office area and not remote from anywhere. free parking and rooms are spacious! It has kitchenette
Manager Response: Thank you for your valuable feedback and I deeply apologize for the issues you encountered during your stay.  We do have a regular exterminator service and I have forwarded your picture to them to correct the situation.  Please fell free to call me at 714-996-0555 if you would like to discuss further.

Summary: This Residence Inn is one of the best we have stayed in.  We getting ready to stay for our 5th time next month, and every time we stay the service is always amazing!  The staff are all very attentive wither its checking in, requesting items to the amazing women whom do the breakfast they make you feel like your at home.  Our son is 10 months this last stay and its very nice that when we arrive our son's bed was set up, like they always have the past visits, and they even took it a step further and placed safety guards in all the outlets my son could reach!    Disneyland is very close only 10 min drive, with quick and easy assess to the freeways.  Which makes it easy to come back and forth to recharge.    This is where we will continue to stay, and have even got our friends and

I am always fond of staying in Marriott for their consistent service. Here, breakfast is available, free parking and rooms are spacious! It has kitchenette which is a plus for me since i cook food for my little one. This is 6miles away from Disneyland. And a few blocks away from the freeway. I find the room cozy and warm , which i love. The receptionist that checked us in is helpful and quite hesitant to assist with my needs. (I was asking help to call Santa Clara Marriott, also requesting for Play and go).  After we checked in and settled, i noticed the bathroom light is not working so immediately they transferred us to another room. We stayed there for the night. Next morning, a roach was laying on the floor near the door. Gross! I did inform them of that but what else can

This Residence Inn is tucked away in a quiet commercial alcove, located conveniently off of CA-57.  Disneyland is approximately 6 miles from this hotel, and it can be reached quickly and easily via the highway or local roads.  The property itself resembles a small apartment community, and is clean and well-maintained.  The only noise during my stay was from the highway located directly behind the property, and although our room was in the very back of the hotel, we did not hear the noise in our room at all. The room itself, a king bed suite, was clean but smelled a bit like dog.  A little air freshener spray took care of that.  The hot breakfast buffet was decent; potatoes, scrambled eggs, waffles, yogurt, bagels, muffins, etc.  The staff is VERY friendly and accommodating.  I

Great place to recharge after a busy day. Clean and neat. Breakfast was amazing. Staff was attentive. Could not ask for more except maybe an elevator since steps are steep. If steps bother you, ask for ground floor.  Definitely will be back when in the area next.

We stayed here to attend a family function and for such extended stays both the location and the price is quite good. the rooms are quite spacious, quiet and the breakfast they serve in the mornings adequate and tasy
Manager Response: Mike D,  Thank you so very much for your kind words and loyal patronage.  We value your business and appreciate your taking the time to rate our hotel.

Summary Heading: I stay here often, and go out of my way to book here
Summary: I'm in the Anaheim area pretty often for work. This is  my first choice hotel when I visit the area. In general, the Residence Inns are nice for extended stays - the kitchenette lets me buy a few meals, since I get tired of eating out all the time. For my purposes, the location is perfect.

I noticed a lot of complaints were about the noise, we had a loft suite on the back of the property ( closest to freeway) and it wasn't a issue at all. My infant slept just fine. I'd stay here again, great service and great breakfast. Small drive to Disneyland.

We arrived very late about 2:00 am. Parked my van and walked to to front door and waited and waited and waited. You have to buzz in when you arrive so late. A very nice gentleman opened the door and started checking  us in. He ran my Marriott Visa and said it was declined for $40.00 (I was using points to pay for my room so credit card was just incase) I said it's impossible there's nothing wrong with it he ran it again and said it was declined and this time turned the screen to show me it was declined. I gave them another Visa. I noticed the breakfast for the next day was already all set out. We didn't eat it so I'm not too sure how fresh it was.  So I went to our room and had to park very far. Once I got to my room I called my Marriott Visa Credit Card and they said  there was
Manager Response: Thank you for your feedback regarding your issues during your stay at the Placentia Residence Inn.  I sincerely apologize for the issues with your credit card upon check-in.  Without more detailed information I am unable to research this further, but would like to follow up with you if possible,  I can be reached at either 714-996-0555 or ri.snapl.gm@marriott.com.

Summary: We booked this hotel last minute. We were allowed to check in early, which was greatly appreciated. The young lady at the desk was spectacular, as was "Cameron", when we called to inquire about the noise upstairs (it did sound like they were bowling). The room, while not the cleanest I've ever seen, was adequate. The bed was clean and comfortable.  Now, with all that in mind, this would seem like an ideal location; but Placentia is mostly industrial, and there is a graffitied car dealership kitty-corner to the hotel.  We were only here a night, and there is nothing that the hotel can do to improve the city - so in all, they actually deserve 4 circles. But, since this is a big picture review, Placentia just needs to be spruced up a bit.
Manager Response: Thank you very much for your response, I appreciate your candid and balanced opinion.  I'd also like to thank you for your kind words regarding Cameron and our desk staff.

Summary: We were in town for a family funeral.  This was a great place to 'escape' from the insanity.  Room was quiet and it was so nice to have a kitchen and living room area.  Staff were so nice.  Cameron and Zackary at the front desk were helpful and kind.   Ramona and the other hospitality staff (breakfast area) were efficient and friendly.  We felt very well taken care of.   Close to the 57 and 91 but no traffic noise.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to review our hotel.  We are delighted that your stay with the Residence Inn Anaheim Placentia/Fullerton was enjoyable.

Summary Heading: Great stay at The Residence Inn.
Summary: We stayed at the Residence Inn for 2 nights while in Anaheim to watch some hockey. From check-in to check-out the front desk staff were very attentive. The pool area was very clean and well maintained.

I stayed here for five nights on business, selecting the Residence Inn brand as I am familiar with this from other locations. I had requested a quiet room and was located in a block near the centre of the complex (the hotel consists of blocks / buildings each contain a small number of rooms / studios. On entering the room the aircon was very noisy so I turned it off. Turning off the noisy fridge followed. But I could hear machinery noise from an adjacent room. I called reception and was given another room, 121. This was fine with the aircon off (although it was getting up to near 30°C during the day the room was fine without aircon) and with the fridge off. I'll write about the room and then come back to the noise issues which followed.  The room was a reasonable size. It was
Manager Response: Thank you for your response.  I truly appreciate the detailed feedback as it will help us to improve in the future.  I apologize for the noise issues you experienced during your stay.  There has been some additional noise issues recently due to some CalTrans roadwork in the area and we do our best to insulate our guests as best we can. I'd like to speak to you personally about your experience and can be reached at 714-996-0555 ext. 7200.    Thank you again for taking the time to give us your feedback!

Summary: This is an older property that is close to a railway crossing with fairly loud trains.  Also you have to drive a bit to get on the highway. This is probably reflected in the lower pricing compared to other Residence Inns.  On the positive side the staff is good.

We stayed here for 6 nights this past July and the location was a pretty good 'base' for travelling  around LA and Anaheim. The room was clean and quiet and while breakfast can be quite busy the staff were great with keeping up to the crowd. The grounds were well kept and there where upgrades to the rooms being made. Overall a very solid family hotel providing a good value in the Anaheim area.

The room suited our needs perfectly.  The full kitchen and extra space was perfect.  It was our first weekend away from home with our 4 month old twins.  There was ample space for 2 pack and plays for the babies to sleep in.  The room didn't feel crowded at all.  We had a king sized bed and lots of cushy, comfy pillows!!  The only slight con was that our room was facing the 57.  The freeway noise didn't really bother us but we would have preferred not to be so close to it.  All in all, we would definitely stay there again.  The room was clean.  The staff was very friendly.  The complimentary breakfast was average and convenient.

Summary Heading: Well kept and clean near business
Summary: This hotel is located close to many businesses in the center of the southern LA basin. This hotel is well maintained and clean. The breakfast is a cut above with a few healthy choices, and the evening reception is too, although they only serve it Monday, Tuesday, and Wednesday evenings. The room I reserved was the room I received. Be sure NOT to leave anything in your car at night. Several cars were broken into.

Compared with other Residence Inns I can only give this one a "poor" rating. We are Marriott Gold Members and made our reservation for a Two Bedroom Suite far ahead, because we intended to stay here with our family for ten days and make sure that we get a specific room type. We also called the front desk the day before our arrival to verify when the room would be ready. They told us 3 pm or earlier. We pointed out that we would arrive from overseas after an 11 hour flight, most likely tired and worn out. When we arrived the next day at 3:15 the room was not cleaned yet. The receptionist told us it would not be ready until 4 pm. We came back at 4 pm. No luck. Now it should be 5 pm. But even at 5 pm they could only offer us a different suite in an awful location directly facing

Summary Heading: Not what I would have expected from a Residence Inn
Summary: I was on a business trip and was booked to stay at this location for 5 nights. As soon as I got the room I knew that I could not stay here for as long, one day was too much, as a fact I changed Residence next day.  I am amazed to hear about renovations from other guest and clean rooms. Mine (room 121) was not one of them, the carpet was dirty and full of stains, big, black stains. The dressers and the drawers were sticky, same for the work desk, the hangers and the shelves were yellowish and gray and look dirty. The bedding was nice and clean but pretty much the only thing that looked fine.  Honestly I was not expecting something like this, maybe is the older building type, there is pretty much no lobby, the breakfast area is too small for the number of guests and if you catch a

My family and I stayed here for a week at the end of July and it was a fantastic stay.  Check in was smooth, rooms are very clean and comfortable.  Daily hot breakfast buffet was great with plenty of options.  Mondays - Wednesdays they have the evening manager's reception.  It's almost enough to fill everyone up for dinner.  They serve up all the beer & wine you want too.  The pool area was nice and you can even grill out for dinner if you want.  It's pretty close to everything in the area.  Disneyland took less than 15 minutes to get to, Newport Beach less than 25.  The staff was so friendly.  The front desk staff were always smiling, answered all my questions, and were very knowledgeable of not only the hotel, but the area as well.  The staff working the breakfast & evening

Traveled here for business one week every month and always enjoyed staying here. The staff is very friendly and hospitable! Rooms have always been clean, but would recommend staying on the 2nd floor as it could sometimes get loud on the 1st floor. Breakfast is pretty good with a nice mixture of waffles, breakfast sandwiches, and other larger meal items that rotate through the week. Rarely ate dinner though as I preferred to eat out.

This hotel has been recently renovated.  The rooms are nice and clean with a full kitchen.  There is a pool, grill, basketball court, and fire pit.  A full breakfast is served every morning.  There are also snacks served Monday-Wednesday evenings.  It is right off the CA-57 and convenient to Disneyland.
Manager Response: Thank you so much for taking the time to add your kind comments.  I am very happy to hear you enjoyed your stay and look forward to the opportunity to serve you again in the future.

Summary: I stayed here due to the close proximity to the college. My son was graduating and I wanted to make sure I was as close as possible to get the best seats possible. The room was updated, clean, spacious, and comfortable. The refrigerator allowed me to pack food and the microwave made a late night snack easy. The small home feel made it a nice stay.
Manager Response: I am very glad you enjoyed your stay with us and that the Penthouse (loft rooms) worked out well for your family.  I hope your visit to Cal. State Fullerton was successful and that the baseball tournament went well.

Summary: My husband, son, and I stayed here for two nights for the Fullerton Regional baseball tournament.  The Residence Inn was only 5-7 mins from Cal State Fullerton.  We had the two bedroom loft style room - it was GREAT.  Tons of room.  A queen w/ its own bathroom upstairs and two queens w/ its own bathroom downstairs.  Also, there is a full sized kitchen [fridge, sink, cabinets, stove, oven], and a living area that has another pull out sofa, and even a table that seats four.  The included breakfast buffet was hot - eggs, pancakes, potatoes, oatmeal, fruit, cereal, pastries, juices/coffe, etc.  Just a few tips:  Bring conditioner because there is only shampoo in the bathrooms, the pillows aren't that great, and expect the breakfast area to be crowded because it is a bit small.  Oh

I and my co-worker stayed at this hotel on business trip to California. We both had to stay in one room so at first, we were not happy about it but then we learned that the room have sofa with bed that comes out. Well, we can then sleep in one room since we both are guys.  The room was clean and have kitchen with everything you need on a small vacation. The carpet was clean enough for me to walk around my bare feet. They have food for breakfast and dinner time. Some days they will put our some beer and vine. Not that I drink but if I was, I’ll be enjoying a free beers!   The front desk counter crew was friendly and helpful. Like the business center. Easy to use and print reports. The breakfast area was clean and have big screen TV.   This is a hotel to use more than one time if

Overall an average Residence Inn but still good. We arrived early and were given a room straight away, which is always nice. It was an upstairs studio suite in block two and fairly clean. The room itself was looking a little worn and could have done with a deep clean. We were not the closest to the freeway but it was still fairly noisy at night so you need to be careful where you are located. The evening reception, with wine and beer, and breakfast were fine and reasonable standard. Staff were generally ok but not excellent. Would stay here again.

Summary Heading: great hotel with a few problems
Summary: I recentley stayed at this hotel for 3 days. My family and I have stayed at this probably more than 7 times. Ramona who is one of the ladys that works in the kitchen in the morning for breakfast and afternoon for the social hour is always really friendley. she always remembers me and my family. i always see her talking to other guest and laughing. The breakfast is very delicious and has great items to choose from like waffles, cereal, scramble eggs, sausage, burruito, canadian bacon, bacon, croisant, different types of breads. as for the light social hour i saw they had taco night, spaggetti night and slidder night with beer and wine and ofcourse soda and water. The room was cleaned i love that it had a king bed, sofa bed, and full kitchen. The sofa bed was not comfortable at

Stayed inthis hotel for two days and found it really nice. Our room came witj a queen size bed, kitchen and spacious bathroom. It was convenient for our familly with 3 young kids. The breakfast crew was very nice and helpful. Would definitely stay here again

The room I stayed in was one of the best I've been in for a Residence Inn.  It may have been recently renovated.  The lobby was also nice with a good breakfast service.  I had to get on the road early, and they even had a cold breakfast set up very early for people that needed to get out .  The fitness room was a little disappointing.  They had a few cardio machines and not really any weights.  However, there is a modest gym two blocks away.  Check with the front desk on getting passes to this gym.  The location is pretty good.  You can quickly get on the 57 freeway which gives you easy access to places in Orange County and Los Angeles.  Disneyland is only about 15-20 minutes away by car.  The only criticism I have about the location is that it may be too close to the freeway

We were in town for a funeral.  My husband and I, and two of my sons and their wives and my teenage son were in our group.  We were able to stay in one of their loft suites that included 3 queen beds and a sofa bed.  It had a full kitchen and a separate bedroom in the loft with it's own bathroom.  We were all able to stay comfortably in one room. It was more like a small condo than a hotel room.  The breakfast had a pretty good variety too.

A good location with easy access to LA and everything south including Disney. We stayed here for four nights and could not fault it. The rooms are clean extremely well equiped and spacious.  Breakfast was included in the rate and had a good selection of hot and cold items. They also have a managers hour several weekdays offering complementary drinks and food.  The staff were all excellent and went out of their way to make our stay a memerable one. I would definately stay here again if I was visiting LA.

So, we've stayed at this hotel before and knew what to expect.  It's quite nice and recently refurbed.  The bed was comfortable and the appliances all worked.  It is close to LA which is nice ( a 50 minute drive with traffic). My only complaint?  The area where they serve the social hour and breakfast is WAY too small.  Maybe 7 tables and a bar area that seats 8.  For a hotel about 20 minutes from Disneyland and for the number of rooms, this is just too small.  No matter what time you arrive, you're waiting for a table.  Also, no local paper on the weekend?  Wrong!

My family and I stayed in a two-bedroom penthouse for a week while visiting Disneyland.  The kitchenette has been totally renovated, however, it would have been nice if the bathrooms had been updated as well.  The orange-striped carpets hurt my eyes, but I got used to it eventually.  Otherwise, this is a good and economical choice for families.

We had a 2 bedroomed penthouse which was great, clean and spacious. The breakfast buffet was OK but there wasn't enough variety of the hot items, more bacon please!! Front desk were OK although had to complain once as we had a phone call at 8am accusing us of running around our second floor apartment, and we were all in bed asleep!! We didn't even get an apology... There were no tins to cook with so had to ask for them, and the dishwasher fell out when we opened the door! It would be helpful if they checked these out before putting guests in the room. Pool was nice and not used much: ask at reception and they'll give you beach balls. Needs a jacuzzi though! No sound from the motorway but the railway was noisy and loud. Motorways were VERY VERY busy, Disney was a bit far away:

Summary Heading: Thank you for a great stay
Summary: The hotel staff was great.  Everyone I came into contact with smiled and was very happy to help.  Even though it is an older hotel, it has been updated and looks great.  The one thing I do not like about these old Residence Inns is the lack of elevators for 2nd floor rooms and the exterior access. Also, the work out rooms was very small and did not have free weights.  We were there to go to Disneyland and at first was not excited about having to drive to and from the park but it was really easy to get to and from without taking the freeway.

Pros:  Standard layout of Residence Inn.  Rooms are very clean.  Easy parking.  Located near fast food restaurants.  Area is quiet even though it is near a busy street and close to the freeway exit.  Great breakfast with good toppings (strawberries, chocolate) for mini waffles that the kids will enjoy making.  Cons:  Oj and apple juice was water down.  The pool wasn't heated.

Summary Heading: Excellent place to stay in the area
Summary: I had some business in the Fullerton area ... which dissapointed me because I normally stay in LA/Hollywood where there is more excitement. However, I didn't want to contend with the horrible traffic that makes a 45 minute morning commute into more of a 2 hour plus deal. So, I decided to boost my Marriott points and stay in Fullerton at the Residence Inn. The idea of this type of chain fascinates me ... everything about it seems like an apartment complex I would have lived in when I was in college. Yet, it is strangely comfortable.  Although I was just there for one night, I realize that these types of hotels are more designed for the traveler who are on an extended business trip and want apartment/homey type of living vs. hotel living for a week or even a month. If you've ever

We enjoy Marriott's style of hospitality, it is our preferred hotel chain.  We chose this Residence Inn because it is away from the busy theme parks in Anaheim.  You do need a car to get around, but access to the freeway is close and easy. We stayed two nights during the Labor Day weekend, so of course the place was busy with families but also college soccer teams.  The sparkling pool and sports court were popular.  We liked the well-maintained, mature landscaping around the parking areas:  they provided much appreciated shade for our rental car.   When we checked in there were no upstairs units available, so we settled for a long, narrow studio on the ground floor.  Normally exterior stairs can cause noise problems, but this time we had noisy upstairs neighbors.  And it wasn't

Summary Heading: As always, Residence Inn never fails...
Summary: Decided to spend the weekend away from the heat and close to family (although Placentia is 20 degrees hotter than where I live). It's the older style Residence Inn, with separate units, which I prefer over the newer hotel style. Initial front desk service was excellent and always with a smile! Never had any major issues in the 20 years staying at Marriott hotels, but ran into a problem this time. After a 100 degree day our air conditioner stopped cooling the room sometime while sleeping. To make a long story short, the front desk staff really took care of the problem and although I lost a good night's sleep, I'll definitely come back here again!

Residence Inn Anaheim Placentia/Fullerton stays with the standard presented by the Marriotts Hotels.  This is a Inn is clean, comfortable and quite.  Located in an area that is primarily business, this Inn may not be for the vacation traveler unless you want stay away from the normal tourist areas; ala, Disneyland.  The only major negative is there are no restuarants located close to the Hotel.  For major restuarants you will have to drive 4 to 5 miles.  Over all a good stay.

I stayed at the hotel for several weeks (Mon-Fri) over the course of 1 month. The staff was super-friendly and helpful. I stayed in the studio room which was perfect for me. Full kitchen, desk/table for working or eating. Air conditioning worked great in the room (very thankful for that during my stay in Aug).  There's a pool and a basketball court. Breakfast was hot each morning - eggs, potatoes, oatmeal, yogurt, waffles, fruit, juice, muffins, etc. Changed daily. Mon, Tues, and Wed nights from 5:30 - 7:00pm there's a happy hour with beer, wine, punch, fruit, and a rotating selection of things like hamburgers, pasta, hot wings, salsbury steak, etc.  Location is convenient to the 57 and 91 freeways. Nearest store and Target is 4-5 blocks down the road (not far at all).

I was in the process of moving to CA fromt the midwest and ended up having to stay in the hotel for over 10 days.  Breakfast was decent and rotated so that it wasn't too repetitve.  Rooms were comfortable and clean - having the full kitchen was great so I could prepare some of my dinners/lunches.  The only thing that bothered me about the room is that it was overly red.  Red is such a strong color to have on the wall and it was rather overpowering/dark.  There was a Juliette balcony off my room but I couldn't keep it open b/c there wasn't a screen and i was afraid that my cat would get out.  (Wonderful that the hotel accepts pets for a 1 time fee of $100). There was also a group of teenangers staying in the hotel and they would get very loud.  I finally complained one night b/c

My family stayed in the two bedroom penthouse suite for one week. The room is nice and clean. Plenty spaces to let five people to stay in. Kitchen is equipped well with items we need for all of us. The bed was nice but I wish it can be firmer. Wireless internet access is now available throughout the hotel which is a huge plus. Staffs are very friendly and helpful. The hotel provides continental breakfast including sausage, eggs, potato, waffle, oatmeal, cereal, toast, yogurt, and fresh fruits. One thing I was very impressed was that the staffs would keep replenishing food even getting close to the end of breakfast time. Some places I have been don't do that when it's near the end of breakfast hours. Coffee and tea were provided at the lobby all day, which made me and my family

My daughter and I stayed here June 25th and 26th.  I was reading many reviews and trying to stay close to Disneyland. I had a free night from a promotion, so was looking more at Marriot. After reading many reviews on here I was scared to stay in a cheaper hotel. This place was perfect! We checked in and they didnt have the King size room ready but they had a handicapped acssesible which was fine, so we didn't wait for the king. Room 1131, bottom floor on corner. The room was a nice size with sitting area and kitchen. Everything was immaculate! Comfortable bedding! Erica who checked us in was a doll and very helpful. We went to the pool-very nice and relaxing. Plenty of food choices in area. They had El Torito listed on there website- downloaded coupon for free guacamole- but

Not sure how helpful this review will be as we checked in at 11.30 pm and left by 8.00am the next morning.  The location was not what we were expecting but since we weren't staying long that didn't matter much to us.  The bed was comfy.  We fell asleep immediately. We didn't have the free breakfast.  The room was clean and for us, that's important.

I was on a two-week business trip to Fullerton, California and I had the pleasure of staying at the Residence Inn in Placentia, checked in on Monday and out on Friday of the following week and it was a great experience. The hotel is located at the east end of Kimberly Ave in Placentia, the location is really great because it is minutes away from Fullerton College, about 10 minutes away from Disney Land, 15 minutes away from Angel Station and Honda Center where the Anaheim Angels and Anaheim Mighty Ducks play. There is a motel nearby and then all the other neighbors of the hotel are various businesses so after the working hours it is really quiet at the hotel. All rooms in the hotels are of condo/resort style, usually there are about 8 or so units in each building (4 on each

My familty of four stayed at this Residence Inn for a trip to Disneyland.  While it was about a 10-minute drive to the park, I am so happy we decided to stay here instead of the congestion of being on top of the park.  The staff was friendly and ready to satisfy all of my family's questions and needs.  The property is great, pods of condo-style rooms with courtyards, many of which have BBQs.  I will stay here everytime I return to the area.

Summary Heading: Very good option for Disney travelers
Summary: We stayed in this hotel as a family of five (4 adults and a toddler). We booked the loft suite which had a reasonable price when compared to other hotels in Anaheim area. Our experience was pretty satisfying, with a new and fully equipped kitchen, large sitting room area and a large bedroom downstairs which is very good if you have a pack n play to set up for the toddler. One of the negative things is that upstairs bedroom and bed is quite small for two people. The bathroom is squeezed and it was hard for my parents to sleep there because the bed was small. Also the walls are really thin; you can hear the footsteps of the person walking upstairs when you are downstairs. This may cause some sleep problems if you are a light sleeper.   Other than that, the room service was very

I stayed a couple nights there. Business. This hotel is comparable to a $59 Days Inn, or a Comfort Inn elsewhere in the South Western US. At just under $100 per night it was barely passable. But that's to be expected for a 'cheap' hotel near Disneyland.  The hotel doesn't measure up to my personal standards. But for a single business stay where my family isn't with me I can deal with staying there. Would I recommend it to others? I'd give a qualified yes. For example, one night when I was about to retire, I could hear party animals in the parking lot. Kids drinking and yelling. Not a good combination for a good nights rest.  Overall I rate this hotel poorly only because the price is too much for what I'd expect from a Mariott Hotell chain. I think I would have done just as well

Great hotel for the price. We used Priceline and got a rate of $55/night for Thanksgiving weekend. The place looks and feels like a townhome/apartment complex with multiple free-standing buildings on the property, each housing several rooms.  Our room had a king-sized bed, flat screen TV that was probably 42 inches, a decent sized living room, and kitchenette with a full-sized oven and range, microwave, and fridge. The interior, as with most new Marriott places, has a modern fell -- lots of neutrals with red accents and fixtures and appliances with a brushed metal look.  The only negative is that there is no wifi. They have an ethernet connection located in the desk by the kitchenette, but that's useless if you have an iPad or want to use a laptop anywhere else in the room.

Summary Heading: Great hotel, great front desk...no bed bugs!
Summary: Just returned from a weekend in Disneyland.  Looked for a hotel closer to Disney, but the reviews were not great for something affordable and close.  I decided I wanted my Marriott...you can always count on a great bed and shower and they are always clean.  We couldn't afford one right by Disney, but this one was right off the freeway and a short drive to Disney.  The staff at check-in was great!  She asked where we were going and provided a map with directions to Disneyland and a list of local restaurants.  Some other customers were using the BBQ grill outside and asked for plates, napkins, cups etc which they provided.  I loved the unique way they had different buildings with 8 rooms each.  It looked more like little condos than a hotel. The grounds were very beautiful and

I had a very bad experience at this Residence Inn.  It is one of the older type Residence Inn.  I was first given a room towards the back.  With the travels I have done, I felt unsafe.  I requested another room and this one had bedbugs.  There were clump of bites on my back and arms.  It took over 2 weeks for the itchiness to go away and left dark scars. I contacted the hotel and spoke with Manager who indicated that they would inspect the room and contact me on their findings.  No return call was ever received. My coworkers suggested I contact the health authorities.  I have done much travel for work, and was at this facility due to last minute assignment and the cap on my travel allowance.
Manager Response: Thank you very much for your comments. We appreciate all types of feedback as it allows us to create a better experience for all our guests. We are very sorry you had such an unpleasant experience at our hotel. Complaints of this nature are taken very seriously by our staff and we've completed a thorough inspection. Even though we have not found any bedbugs we have treated the rooms as a precautionary measure. I'm happy to discuss this further if you'd like to contact me directly. Warm Regards, Steve Ashe, General Manager

Summary Heading: Good Location but no Elevator/Wireless Internet
Summary: When we travel we cook our own food so we pack a lot of bags. This location was Cool to Disneyland but there is no wireless Breakfast was good and they seemed understaffed. Overall ok if you do not have seniors.

This has been my 4th stay at this hotel im usually here for 3 days. I love it so much but ofcourse it isnt always available so i end up at other marriotts booo. The complimentray breakfast is delicious. I love the waffle maker. The kitchen staff are so friendley. The rooms are always clean i never complain about noise. The only thing they need to work on is their Front Desk agents. They don't have a clue where places are and can't give directions from where your at example i was at food 4 less looking for toys r us they couldnt give me directions like really you couldnt google it for me. i was upset about that, so now i just take a gps to take care of that problem. i have found bugs in my room either in bathroom or by the sink. i understand their just small deert bugs not a big

Stopped in here for the second time in the past 6 months.  Both times I found the front desk very friendly and helpful.  As others have written, the facility is set up in pods of eight rooms, 4 uppers & 4 lowers.  They do have the some giant suites with an upper loft and bedroom (was upgraded to this suite the first time...a lot of room for a solo traveler!!).  Mon-Wed night they have complimentary dinner - nothing to get excited about, but if you're too tired to find a restaurant in the area (which is a challenge) it is a good place to fill up (includes beer and wine).  Complimentary breakfast us served 7 days a week - again nothing to get excited about.  The rooms are spacious and clean, although the furniture is starting to show a little wear.  The room has a good desk to

This property is built in the style of separate buildings, each with a few rooms. In other words, to get anywhere, including to the front desk, you must go outside. If that's not for you, stop reading and look elsewhere.  But if you don't mind that you'll get a lovely room. Had a studio that was a decent size. Full kitchen included. Bed was comfy.   Nothing that you're going to walk to, but shopping is nearby. There's a Stater Bros. supermarket on State College just south of the 91 Freeway where you can pick up stuff.   Wouldn't hesitate to return.

My husband and I used points for our stay at the Residence Inn Placentia while visiting family in the area. I have to say, the hotel was better than I expected as some Residence Inn's I've stayed at are on the older side. We had an upper room (which I loved - no one above us - bear in mind there are no elevators and you have to climb stairs with luggage) and it appeared recently updated. The kitchenette had everything you would need if you wanted to cook your own meals with new appliances (fridge, stove and microwave). There was a nice work station with a ethernet cable to get to the internet (no wifi) which was fine - we didn't need it as we didn't have computer with us - just our smartphones. The bathroom was also recently remodeled with granite like counters and new shower

Stayed in the hotel for five days and have no complaints except one very big one. The rooms don't have wifi built into them (they do have wired) and if you try to create your own access point then they will completely block your internet connection in your room. In today's world of smart phones and tablets this seems so primitive.

Summary Heading: This is where you want to stay...........
Summary: We have stayed at this RI a few times over the years. Just got back from a Dec.22/26 stay, a Disneyland trip. An easy 12 minute drive gets you to D-land. And the staff could not have been nicer. Not a single problem. Everything clean, pool was 85 plus degrees, beds comfortable, handy kitchen. What else do you need? Thanks to Steve, Nancy, Yuri, and Joanna. Don't waste hours looking for a place closer to the park, you will pay at least  double ( we paid $150/night for a 3 queen, 2 bedroom penthouse suite, or an old hotel/motel that may be a  dive. WE WILL BE BACK!!!!!!!

I stayed here 1 1/2 years ago and liked it then.  Since  then, it looks as though they've gone through a complete refurb.  It's beautiful.  New furniture, appliances, etc.  It's just down the road from Disneyland so you're near the attractions without being right there!  Loved it. My only complaint...though they say in their information that there's a local paper available, on the weekend, there was only the WSJ Weekend.  That was the only disappointment.

I had a great experience at this property during my 5 night stay.  The staff was very friendly and attentive.  Great perks like the morning breakfast and the early evening snacks (with Beer or Wine)...how cool is that!  They will even do grocery shopping for you during the day with no service charge.  I got a very good price (about $99 per night) and with the food and beverages (am and pm) this was an exceptional value.  The property is a collection of smaller buildings (perhaps 8 units per building) with nicely landscaped walkways to the lobby, pool and recreation area (hoops, etc.)  The bed was excellent and the room spacious with a kitchen, living area and bed area.  The neighborhood has an industrial feel and is a little off the beaten path. Only a 10 or 15 minute drive to

Summary Heading: Great value for going to Disney!
Summary: We just returned from a five night stay here.  The purpose of our trip was Disneyland...this was just what we needed.  There were five in our party, so we had the 2 BDRM loft.  Bedroom/bath upstairs and a two queens and bath in a bedroom downstairs.  Also a full kitchen and sofa bed in the living area.  Excellent breakfast in the morning with something different for the "main dish" daily, with the same waffles, cereal, cooked (not instant) oatmeal, pastries, etc. also included.  The staff was fantastic at the breakfast area, keeping things stocked and even bringing things to our table when something was out.  We had a car so driving was not an issue.  The drive to Disney was very easy on surface streets and took about 10-15 minutes.  No traffic until you hit Harbor Blvd. for

We just returned from this property and found it to be very nice. Check in was great and the room was beautiful. We had just stayed at a Hilton property that charged for everything but air. It was nice to have free parking, Internet and breakfast. I would definitely stay here again as it is close to so many things.

I have a fondness for Residence Inn's properties since a unexpected flight delay in Colorado a few years ago and they treated our family very well, and  was greatly appreciated considering we were already irate. So I tend to be a little biased. This property has the same feel, it's clean, spacious, it is at the end of a cul du sac and is relatively quite, however we did hear a train go by once or twice and we were near the basketball court and pool but the noise level was barely audible. We were visting for one night for Medevil Times and Irvine Spectrum. The hotel was about 15 minutes away from the show. We didn't go down for breakfast, we made breakfast in the room. Three flat screens kept the peace for the most part (more on that later), the two baths were also nice,

My wife and I were driving back from San Diego and stopped in to see the Nixon Museum in Yorba Linda.  We planned to stay overnight somewhere close and this hotel fit our needs.   The Residence Inn Marriott in Placentia is a very nice suite type complex. It’s a condo style building in clusters of eight rooms, four rooms on the first floor and four on the second. The room is large size with a couch, recliner and coffee table.  There’s a large flat screen TV in the middle of the room on top of a dresser that you swivel and watch from the bed.  There were some HD channels coming across cable that looked outstanding.  There’s a full kitchen, stove, dishwasher, refrigerator, sink, dishes and utensils.  In this large room, there was no suit case stand and I was rather surprised.

I was looking for a place for our family to stay while we visited the Disneyland Resort.  We had a car that we could take to and from the resort - so proximity wasn't an issue.  It was a 4 mile trip.  We stayed in the 2 bedroom/ 2 bath suite.  Downstairs is a kitchen, living room (with pull out sofabed) and a bedroom with 2 queen beds and bath.  Upstairs is a loft with 1 queen bed and a bathroom.  We were very comfortable with our group of 4 adults and 1 child.  Free parking and complimentary breakfast are an added bonus.

Summary Heading: The customer service is wonderful- thanks to Yuri
Summary: I could not find my watch so I called, Yuri called me back said they couldn't find it. I usually never the call back. The service is great also!

My wife and I  have stayed in 3-5 star hotels here and abroad and we rate our satisfaction with our stay at this hotel among the highest, relative to amenities, cleanliness, friendly staff and value. Among the amenities is the pool area with its fire pit and BBQ grill available for use. The room itself was large, equipped with a kitchenette, and a large bathroom set up for handicap use (although we did not need it). A full breakfast buffet was available, with a good variety of items that would satisfy most people.  The only negative we encountered in our particular room was some water from the shower (no dam on the shower floor) flowing onto the floor near the sink. So, if you do not need the handicap feature, you may want to ask for a different room.  We would highly recommend

We stayed here for a 10 day trip that combine business and visiting family. The front desk staff were wonderful and always ready to assist us with our requests. The hotel offers free internet access, however  we needed to request a wireless set up as both of us needed to have internet access. The hotel set this up for us and it worked very well. The desk/table combo was big enough for us both to have our laptops up and running. The bedding was comfortable. The property was fairly quiet. We had a room away from the freeway so we did not hear any noise from that. However it would be something to consider when booking here as some of the buildings/rooms are very close to the freeway. The fitness center is super small with one treadmill and a bike. The treadmill worked fine did not

We've stayed at almost half of the Anaheim area hotels in the past few years searching for the perfect combination of value, amenities and location. This Residence Inn has made up for its location (a good 10-15 min. drive from Disneyland) with the great rooms, great service (loved the little breakfast lady who spoiled my kids!), and great value. It's a quiet property without the overwhelming amount of children screaming - common for Anaheim hotels. We had a couple of issues with our room - a phone issue, a light that wouldn't turn off and no bedding for the crib or sofabed. With only one employee on the premises at night, we ended up fixing things ourselves or doing without. But really, nothing major and we will return.

This was our second time staying at this Residence Inn, and I'm so happy we did! We had a bi-level loft suite. Very roomy with a full kitchen and supplies. Two full bathrooms, fireplace, living room area, dining table and chairs.  We had a queen size bed in the upstairs loft and two queen size beds in the bedroom on the first floor.  We had three flat screens TVs, 1 upstairs and 2 downstairs. It was very quite, very relaxing and just like our last visit, it was a little slice of heaven.  In the mornings they serve a free breakfast. It's very good. They have a swimming pool, jacquizzi, BBQ grill and plenty of lounge chairs. They also have a combination volleyball/basketball court. Laundry room and in the lobby they have a 24 hour little market. Very convenient.  My only

Summary Heading: Great place to stay for groups
Summary: Having stayed at a few Residence Inns in the past few years, I have to say that they never disappoint.  This property is a great option for families visiting the local theme parks (Knott's or Disneyland) they're both only 15 minutes away.  No other real amenities nearby as the property is in the middle of a light industrial/commercial area.  Room was a 2 bedroom (1 upstairs in a loft) 2 bath suite with full kitchen.  The only complaint (and it was more amusing than annoying) that I have about the room is that the remote controls for the LG flat screen TVs were too sensitive and you could change the channel on both TVs from either the loft or the downstairs living room.  Breakfast was standard buffet type with some pre made sausage and egg muffins, a waffle iron with batter

I got a free upgrade from a standard room to a penthouse suite, which was very nice - and a huge space for one traveler. The room had been recently updated, so it was in very good condition. Overall the hotel is clearly under reconstruction as they update the whole place, but it appears that they try to place most travelers in rooms already finished. Breakfast was done well, but not a lot of choices. Service was competent. Only issue really was the highway noise from the 8 lane highway just outside the room - more soundproofing would really help. Would also like to see Wifi so I don't have to work from wired connection at desk.

My husband and I recently stayed at this hotel for 4 days as part of a trip around California / Las Vegas.  We had a studio king suite which was plenty big enough for 2 of us.  It had a full kitchen, flat screen TV which we could watch in either the seating or the bed area and free Internet Access. The bed in our room was extremely comfortable. The room was cleaned every day to a very high standard.  The staff were very friendly and helpful whenever we needed anything. As with a lot of these hotels it was slightly tucked out of the way but we had a car and there were plenty of shops within just a few minutes drive.  We didn't try the hotel breakfasts as we mostly made our own.

We have stayed at this hotel twice now.  The first time was great.  The service was amazing...especially the older lady that worked with the breakfasts.  This time there were nothing but rude people working everywhere from the front desk to the breakfast workers.  Housekeepers were very friendly and nice though.

Reserved room via hotels.com and got an excellent price.  This hotel excels the nearby Holiday Inn Express in Placentia.  Spacious room with kitchenette, free hot and cold breakfast in lobby area, very clean and quiet, friendly staff.  Only negative is no DVD player in room, so bring your computer or DVD player.  Otherwise would strongly recommend.

I was very pleased with my 2-day stay this week.  The room was large, bright and felt safe.  The staff was very friendly and seemed to sincerely want to make the customer experience a good one.  In terms of location, you really do need a car but it is a short drive to a grocery, restaurants, etc.  There were also many options for in-room delivery from lots of restaurants.  I was attending a conference in Yorba Linda and it was a very short commute with little to no traffic.

Summary Heading: Close to everything in Anaheim, excellent value!
Summary: Stayed with friends for a Concert, very close to Disneyland.  No frills, stayed in the 2 bed loft, tow great bathrooms, living room, free wifi and breakfast, full kitchen. Even has fireplace.  Everything clean and practical.

Summary Heading: Great value, clean, rennovated in Sept. 2009, excellent family hotel, and a short drive to Disneyland.
Summary: I stayed here with my wife and 2 kids (3 yrs + 2 months) in February 2010.  It was a family trip to take my son to Disneyland and I needed something relatively close, clean, and a kitchen.  Thanks to reviewers on Tripadvisor, I found out that the hotel was completely updated in Sept. 2009.  I used to travel allot for business and am accustomed to staying in both 4 and 5-star hotels.  Given that, I was a little concerned with staying at the Residence Inn.  It DID NOT disappoint.  While the hotel is probably a 3.5 star hotel, it's very clean, the service is good, and they even offer a complimentary breakfast (inclusive of eggs, bacon, and waffles!)  The sofa converts into a sofa bed.  While it's not ideal for an adult, a young child will find it plenty comfortable.  I say it's not

We stayed here for our annual Disneyland trip and we were very happy with it. The room was great for us (Bi-level loft, 3 adults and 1 child) we loved everything about it (Spacious and clean). Housekeeping was fabulous. Front dest staff was always pleasant and more than helpful. Continental breakfast was awesome (the dining area can get a bit crowded). You may hear the distant sound of trains in the night if you are a light sleeper but it really did not bother us. We will definately be back to this hotel!!

This was our first time staying at a Residence Inn, and I'm so happy we found it!  We had a bi-level loft suite.  Very roomy with a full kitchen and supplies.  Two full bathrooms, fireplace, living room area, dining room and computer area, then at night it converts into a Murphy bed which was very comfy.  We had two flat screens TVs, upstairs and downstairs.  It was very quite, very relaxing and it just made our little trip a little slice of heaven.  In the mornings they serve a free breakfast.  It's very good.  They have a swimming pool, jacquizzi, BBQ grill and plenty of lounge chairs.  They also have a combonation volleyball/basketball court.  Laundry room and in the lobby they have a 24 hour little market.  Very convenient.  Can't wait to stay here again!

My hubby and I had a funeral to attend in the southern California area, so I booked a 3 star room on Priceline for $45 a night. I have never stayed at a Ressidence Inn before, so I didn't know what to expect. We arrived around 5 on a Tues. evening and check-in was a breeze. Mon-Wed. they have a lite dinner in the dinning area, but we had already eaten. Our room was in the back next to the highway, but the noice wasn't bad at all. I was very impressed! Our room had a full kitchen with modern appliances and the everything you might need (plates, flatware, glasses, even cloth napkins!!). It had granite counter tops, tile floors, nice lighting. The room was large, with sofa, chair and coffee table, and large, flat screen T.V. The bathroom area wasn't anything special, but all was

Summary Heading: You can't go wrong with Marriott.
Summary: We stayed here while in town for the Long Beach Grand Prix.  Yes, it's quite far from LongBeach, but we had to pick people up in Anaheim on the way down there.  We had a room with a loft and 2 baths that slept six.  The value was excellent, considering that the parking, internet and hot breakfast were all free.  We also got a $25 Exxon gift card for each night we stayed (booked through Marriott).  The buildings were a little older, but the bedding and furniture was typical of all Marriott properties.  I like the Residence Inns because I like the convenience of the full kitchen...especially when you are staying for more than a day or two.  We didn't do anything in the area, so my review just pretty much lets you know that the hotel is just fine!
I can stay at any Marriotts Hotels, Residence Inns or Fairfield Inns and know that i will get the best attention, service and comfortness.

I stayed at the Residence in for 3 weeks in October/November.  This was my 3rd stay.  In my past visits, I found the self-contained rooms quite comfortable, but getting tired.  This visit, my suite (with loft) had just been modernised and upgraded.  It was beautiful and fresh.  There were flat screen TVs in the livingroom,  master bedroom and loft bedroom.  The staff accommodated my desire for unrushed mornings and did all the cleaning when I was out in the afternoon.  All in all it was a perfect stay and very, very good value.  I love this place.

I was a little concerned after reading some of the reviews on tripadvisor. Our experience was great though. We stayed in one of the rooms with a King in one bedroom and a queen in the upstairs loft. Every thing was clean and well taken care of, as expected at a Residence Inn. The beds were good and the room was in good order. It's true some of the cabinetry is a little dated and the like, but in general the facility is well maintained. They started another renovation in June, but only have completed three rooms. My wife is very particular when it comes to hotels, but she was very happy. It was nice to have a  full kitchen so we did not have to eat out all the time. It is less than 10 min to Disney land on CA 57 and half the cost of  the Residence Inn Main gate.

Summary Heading: Good place, but needs a facelift...and is getting one
Summary: I have stayed here before, but two or three years ago.  I usually stay in Anaheim, but this past trip the hotels were all booked there, so I came up here again.  It's only about 10 minutes from Anaheim, so the location is good.  The hotel is laid out in little buildings with a few units in each and walkways in between.  The staff here is very nice and helpful.  The breakfast is just OK, but certainly adequate for a quick bite on the way out the door.  The pool and hot tub look nice, but I did not get a chance to use them.  The rooms are nice and big and with a nice work surface in between the kitchen area and sitting area.  The kitchen comes with a stove, coffee maker, refrigerator, microwave oven, sink, and dishwasher.  It is also stocked with plates, glasses, pans, silverware,

The hotel is in a more industrial location but that just made for some very quiet surroundings.  Breakfast was never crowded, our room was very clean and quiet and the rate could not be beat.  The 10-15 minute drive to Disneyland was just fine, especially considering how cheap the room was compared to the Residence Inn Maingate.  We'll definitely stay here again!

I just stayed at the Marriott Residence Inn Anaheim Placentia/Fullerton, and I have to say was a little on the disappointed side.  Although the front desk was nice in checking in,  a little green, didn’t seem to know what the pool hours were.  I’d assume that even if any random person was working at the front desk who didn’t know anything about those hours, that it would at least be posted somewhere or they would train themselves to know that simple easy tidbit.  My issue was I always like to hook up my DVD Player as I don’t prefer cable or regular Television, but prefer to choose what I want to watch.  There was no hook up anywhere with the tv’s, it was like being right out of the 19th century.  This is 2009, how does that hotel not have a DVD hook up capability?    When I

Summary Heading: Good Week Long Stay, Courteous Staff, Not So Great Location
Summary: We used Marriott points for our week long Southern California getaway.  The staff was very courteous and met everyone of our needs attentively.  Breakfast was average, but that's what I pretty much expected.  They did have a large variety to choose from and it did change daily.  The rooms were a little on the outdated side but overall the room was very clean and housekeeping did a good job of cleaning the entire studio daily.  The only downfall was the location, a little bit out of the way and off the beaten path.  Overall if I was to choose a Residence Inn it would probably be one of the Residence Inn's closer to Disneyland but if booked I would stay here again.

Pro - Great place. Courtyard setting, large room, full kitchen, very clean.  Con: The noisiest room I ever stayed in! My bed was 20 feet away from the refrigerator. I just turned unplugged it. My food stayed fresh overnight. During the day the noise was still distracting.  The heating/cooling system was also loud. I turned that off, also. Luckily the weather was amenable to this.  Other than that, great place. Won't visit again, though.

We got to our room where we found waiting for us about 15 flies in each of the bedrooms and about the same number in the kitchen.  There was some left over food crumbs from the last occupant sitting on the fireplace surround.  Called the front desk and they said the flies were typical of the rooms in June, so moving rooms wouldn't help.  They put in some flypaper in each of the rooms (they offered to spray but we didn't want that with our young kids).  We went to the tiny pool and it was towel-less, with cloudy as opposed to clear water.  Went to breakfast the next morning and it was overrun with people with no tables, with cereal all over the floor, and many of the complimentary breakfast items like eggs and waffle batter were empty for at least 30 minutes.  The staff said the

Great location and excellent rates.  Room was clean but needed new carpet and bathroom updated.  Breakfast was below average in comparison to other Residence Inn.   Staff was courteous except for one person at the front desk on the day when we checked in.

This is a somewhat older Residence Inn, that I had stayed at a few years ago.  During more recent trips, we have stayed at the Residence Inn Garden Grove but because they were booked we decided to stay here.  We reserved a Penthouse room.  It was a little older but still well maintained, everything was clean and the water pressure in both bathrooms was good.  One of the kids decided to sleep on the sofa bed and though I didn't think it seemed that comfortable, he was happy there for all 5 nights.  The murphy bed was really comfortable too.  The wired internet access is downstairs, on a desk next to the murphy bed and I was a little worried about using the computer because the kids were sleeping there but the wireless internet worked for the desk upstairs even though we were on

Summary Heading: Good location in south LA area
Summary: We stayed here because we we on our way to San Diego the next day and wanted to be in the south LA area. Also, we went to the Aquarium of the Pacific at Long Beach and this seemed to be reasonably close.  We have stayed at a few Residence Inns and we like the fact that the rooms are not in a closed hotel but are accessible from outside. We also like the kitchen in each unit. This time we had a studio with a king and a pullout which worked just fine for our family of 4.  We did drive up to the Disneyland area to eat and it is only a 20 minute drive although there are places to eat in the area.  The room was clean if maybe a little dated. Not shabby or worn but maybe due for a refreshing. The beds were comfortable.  The heated pool was warmer than most heated pool but we liked

The rooms in this hotel are run down and dingy. The housekeeping never changed the towels or sheets and the carpet was never vacumed. When I spoke to the management I was ignored and laughed at. I was stuck in this hotel for months on end due to a work arrangement. I have stayed in other Mariott's and this one was by far the worst! Do yourself a favor and don't stay here!

Summary Heading: I would not return.  Sure not like other Residence Inn's
Summary: Our check in started with a not so helpful front desk person but luckily the managers office was just off the lobby and I think he heard what was being said and quickly came out and took care of the matter himself. The breakfast is a joke!  Not one day was there enough food for the guests.  Things were constantly empty and believe me when they say the breakfast ends at 9:00am, they mean it! The pool area was often filthy.  Probably since the breakfast room was not big enough, people sat by the pool but then hotel staff seemed to forget there was tables out there. I had an issue and had to call a hotel staff member and I never received a call back. The landscaping was very nice.  Our room was nice but the floors were really loud and so I was really worried about the people below

Summary Heading: Nice motel but watch pet fee!
Summary: We stayed here after visiting Disneyland, primarily because it was near the park, we could use our Marriott points -- so the room was "free", but we had to pay a $75 pet fee for one night for our dog.  This was still cheaper than we could find a reasonable hotel elsewhere in the area, so we chose to stay here.   However, we definitely resented the high pet fee for a one-night stay.  (As the check-out person pointed out as we left (and complained) that $75 is a one-time charge, so if you stay there a week -- which is what this type of hotel caters to, longer-term stays -- then it is more economical...)  The room was nice.  Had a kitchen, living area, bed /bath area.  It was in good shape.  Free internet access.  The breakfast was pretty complete, with eggs/bacon as well as the

I had to be out of my house for a week because of some remodeling, and after staying at the Residence Inn Placentia; I didn't want to go home! The staff was superb: very friendly and welcoming! The atmosphere was great for my family providing breakfast every morning and dinner for most of the week! I would definitely stay here again!

Summary Heading: Usually Residence Inn is a good place to stay.....
Summary: We have stayed at Residence Inns before and have always found them to be pleasant properties - not this time.  There were three in our party - two adults and one child. I originally choose this property because they had penthouse suites. When we arrived at 5pm, we were told all the penthouse suites were gone. They did have two studio suites available that were “pretty close” to each other. I said that was unacceptable since we had a child with us and we were not going to put her in a studio alone. I mentioned that I had reserved a penthouse suite, so we needed either a penthouse or two connected rooms. After a few moments of typing on his computer, a penthouse "became" available. What? I though they were all gone..... What are they trying to pull? The room was fine, but very

We stayed there in May 2005 for a family function in Anaheim.  Overall very clean and new.  However, the carpets need cleaned.  I let my toddler son run around the room in his white socks and they are now stained black.  The area is not the greatest.  We arrived at 2:00 in the morning and there were some questionable people hanging around.  There was however, a security guard hanging around as well.  The breakfast was great.  If I couldn't get something closer to Anaheim, I would stay here again.

We stayed at this facility for two week long trips, one in October 2003 and one in December 2003.  Both were excellent.  Great breakfast (free) not extravagant, but hot things such as waffles, eggs and biscuits...as well as a variety of danishes, muffins, bagles and of course cereal.  The beds were pretty firm, I'll have to admit- but everything else was terrific.  Don't expect the absolute lap of luxury...but do expect a very nice, clean room with "real" towels and bedding.  The kitchens are well stocked with everything you need as far as pots and pans, utensils, etc.  We love this place, yes it is a distance from the Disneyland- but you get to avoid all the noise and hassle involved with being right close.  We have annual passes and will continue to stay here every time.

I like the Residence Inn esp when I heard that this property was renovated May 2003. We went June 2003. Location though is a little off, you have to have a car. If you're going to Disneyland they dont offer a shuttle (we took our car, but we asked before making the reservation).  I only chose this one since Residence Inn Anaheim was charging $100 more per night and I wanted a newer facility. I guess this facility is ok for those on business trip within the area. Its your typical Residence Inn, my first priority was to have a CLEAN place to stay.
